Review Text: #negative review Place :Cafe bbq / bbq bd gulshan 2 Food : 6/10 Drinks :2/10 Service 2/10... Gelam ek friend er sathe khaite. 2 joner e pet motamuti vora cilo bole nilam share platter namer item ta jar price 1000 Platter includes all these and 2 drinks according to description. Pic dawa platter tar ar 2 ta fancy drink er. Order korar sathe sathe amak jigesh korlo sir drink ki niben. Bollam ki option ase? Bollo blue mojito na ki jani Ekta aro 2 -3 ta bollo and green apple er Ekta. Ami bollam apnader jei 2 ta iccha den eigula moddhe. Bollo sir blue ta e green apple ta ani? Bollam anen. Sudhu platter ta ar ei 2 ta drink amader dilo. Bolai vaguely platter ta sufficient na 2 joner jonno ar drink gila as usual fancy namer sprite. Minimum kono variety nai. Bill dawar somoy dekhlam total jeolhan 1150 howar kotha.ami deke Ekjon o bollam drinks to included she bollo sir taito asole sorry vul maybe.pore arekjon eshe bollo na sir vul nai.ami bollam drinks to included na? Bola holo na sir drinks bolte sudhu sprite included Baki 2 ta paid. Apnak sprite ta ene dibo sir? Amak er age sprite ta dawa o hoinai bola o hoinai er kotha. Misleading information er jonno amar 2 ta rong be rong er sprite nite. Ami bolsi vai ami bill o dea disi ekhn sprite dea ki korbo? Amar kotha na sune tao ene dise.ami jigesh korlam amak clearly bola hoinai keno bolle hasi dilo sudhu Ekta. Ami kotha barai nai but barpari type misleading info dawa amar thik lage nai.

Review Text: Great decoration, good service but when it comes to food it could be a lot better. Took the Jamaican chicken. It was a little too sweet for me. I took rice as a side and it was burned. When confronted they replied that it was supposed to have a smoky flavor!!!! I don't know what they meant!!! Anyways the chicken was well cooked, the Mocha according to my friend was also good. Rice was regular vegetable fried rice, nothing special. I have had better fried rice at street carts.... Seemed pretty expensive compared to the quality of food they serve. Good place to hangout with friends and family though. Cheers!!! ***Went their a week or two ago.

Review Text: I've been to bbq in gulshan 2 numerous times and on each occasion I've been thoroughly pleased. The atmosphere is nice, waiters friendly, tables clean and food delicious. Review Text: Today we had the most awful experience at BbQ Dhanmondi branch. They have been offering the 50% discount on beverage and i liked their frappe everytime so went their tonight as it was the last night. And even though we had called at their number and verified that the store was open they denied to serve us the frappes! Not ony that, after providing us the menue the waiter was taking a while to come back. I found that the waiter and the manager was solving a dispute with ano...ther client. So called another younger waiter who was walking towards the table then the other waiter made him stop. He literally stoped him coming towards us and then he took another 5mins to solve the dispute.then this waiter and the manager had another chat, more like whispered in the years then they both came to tell they cannot serve the Frappe!!! They said they ran out of all ingredients! They literally didn't want to make the drinks as it was close to the closing time. They has an offer going on and it cannot be that they ran out of every single ingredients of all the drinks!! Even though we had said we didn't want anything else at all that being an International Chain they should be serving us they denied us completely!! I should also mention we went to the Dhanmondi branch just this friday night and the pizza was terrible too!!! It was nothing like the Gulshan branch pizza. Really really disappointed by this ignorant attitude and i doubt i will ever go back.

Review Text: Okay, here's an honest review. Went to the Dhanmondi Branch yesterday and the food was okay. It was nothing completely out of the ordinary and that would have been completely alright had the items not been priced premium. The service was absolutely horrible! I mean how are you guys still in business with the current lot of waiters? A waiter literally tried to force an item on us by repeatedly insisting in the rudest of manners and the most annoyed of expressions. We had to ca...ll the waiters multiple times before any of them responded, every time. No, they weren't busy, just standing at the nearest tissues counter (or something) doing absolutely nothing. It took them about 15 minutes to get the bill and another 15 to return the change. The music was too loud and they did not turn down the volume even after we requested them to. Please take note that we have not been rude to any of the servers even once through out the whole process. Now, considering the fact that the Dhanmondi branch is a relatively new outlet, the cutlery items used should still be in relatively good condition but they were not. Most of the spoons had so many scratch marks on them that it almost gave the feeling that we had been provided with used utensils from the older branches. Does not reflect the class BBQ BD claims to boast. Not a good experience overall. Not sure if I wanna go back there, not anytime soon at least. P.S.- Can provide pictures if necessary.

Review Text: Bbq Bangladesh Dhanmondi Branch is a big disappointment, Menu card's price of each item really differs with the price of the bill,I have tried your Gulshan branch for almost 6-7times and I loved it, no complains from there.. And 2times at your dhanmondi branch.. My experience was bad both the times there.dhanmondi branch serves completely different quality of food, it's too bad , the quantity of your pane cream soup was very low.. Taste of chicken was bad and served cold. The... second time I went there, the taste of the food was average and I clearly remember that I ordered food costing around 1500 -1600tk on the menu card( Korean Charboiled chicken 3pcs chicken, 1 piece jamaican chicken meal with mashed potatoes and 3 cocacolas). They charged me the double on their bill around 3000tk. I have calculated on my own and it would have been around 1800tk-2000tk with vat and service charge. This was a clear fraud.. This might also be an inside fraud between the manager and the waiters so the authority must take this into consideration.I am never going back to bbq bangladesh again. This was not only me who faced such a problem but also I know few more people disappointed with Bbq Bangladesh dhanmondi's bill problem.

Review Text: I love this place. The Korean charbroiled chicken is to die for. I have been here a lot of times and I have never been disappointed until the last time. I was served cold food, even the mushroom soup was barely warm. Review Text: Yesterday evening at 9 I went there with my family, we took a full platter (4 person). Food was good, but I ordered a fried chicken as parcel along with the food left after we ate. After I get back home I found that all the fried chicken is not given along with the other foods. But I paid for it. They should be more careful about what they are getting paid and what they ate delivering.
Review: Yesterday evening at 9 I went there with my family, we took a full platter (4 person). Food was good, but I ordered a fried chicken as parcel along with the food left after we ate. After I get back home I found that all the fried chicken is not given along with the other foods. But I paid for it. They should be more careful about what they are getting paid and what they ate delivering.

Review Text: Have tried their Signature Biriyani, and the Hydrabadi Biriyani too. Signature one tastes great, but I didn't like the hydrabadi one. Mutton of the biriyani was not well cooked, and I could get the raw smell of meat from that one. But the Signature one is a must try. Also their hospitality was A class, all of their staffs are well mannered. Also the interior is pretty much impressive. Price might seem a bit high comparing to others those serving traditional Indian food, but the quantity is well enough. They say the Indian dishes are single serving, but it seemed a bit much for a person to me. Next time I want to try their Chinese cuisine. Hope it will not be a disappointing one. P.S. Though15% service charge and VAT was not included with the price in their menu, for some reason it was not charged to me.

Review Text: I tried their chicken cheesy burger, Mirzafar burger (chicken) and fries on 2 different occasions and have nothing negative to say. Although I tried only 3-4 burger joints in Dhaka, easy to say they are the best when it comes to price and taste. They are affordable and buy 2 get 1 free is the best deal out there!
Review: I tried their chicken cheesy burger, Mirzafar burger (chicken) and fries on 2 different occasions and have nothing negative to say. Although I tried only 3-4 burger joints in Dhaka, easy to say they are the best when it comes to price and taste. They are affordable and buy 2 get 1 free is the best deal out there!

Review Text: One of the best Burger restaurant in Dhaka. #CaptainCook
Review: One of the best Burger restaurant in Dhaka. #CaptainCook

Review Text: I tried their Signature Beef and Bacon burger. It was absolutely amazing. Solid, well cooked beef patties topped with tender beef strips and the perfect balance of cheese and special sauce. Fresh lettuce, tomato slice and crisp buns made the experience even better. Captain Cook burger is my go-to burger place whenever I go to Shimanto Squire , Dhanmondhi. Please give them a try.
Review: I tried their Signature Beef and Bacon burger. It was absolutely amazing. Solid, well cooked beef patties topped with tender beef strips and the perfect balance of cheese and special sauce. Fresh lettuce, tomato slice and crisp buns made the experience even better. Captain Cook burger is my go-to burger place whenever I go to Shimanto Squire , Dhanmondhi. Please give them a try.

Review Text: This is a great fast food place. I mean it. The food was great. Not too expensive. They have a very classy Burger on menu Like Mr.Pounder & Mr.Alexander. The food serving time was moderate even when it was crowded. I liked that when I asked for water, they also gave me glasses with water not only the bottle. I think they deserve 5 stars. Peace Captain Cook.
Review: This is a great fast food place. I mean it. The food was great. Not too expensive. They have a very classy Burger on menu Like Mr.Pounder & Mr.Alexander. The food serving time was moderate even when it was crowded. I liked that when I asked for water, they also gave me glasses with water not only the bottle. I think they deserve 5 stars. Peace Captain Cook.

Review Text: Captain Cook Dhaka is amazing! Honestly good service and has an unbelievable cheese chicken burger that you could die for and is an all round good restaurant for all ages.this is one of the best restaurants I could ever visit.

Review Text: Comparing to the price the Double Quarter Pounder burger was so yuumy !!! They were humble enough to go to each table to ask if everything was okay. If you're hungry,on a budget and want to have a good bite of burger this is the place !

Review Text: Captain Cook special Mr.Pounder beef is great with Jalapeno and garlic sauce. Patty was great. Juicy enough to make a mess. Spicy enough to make you cry. Place is nice for Hangouts. Chill ambient. Sky view is great. Price is 9/10 Worth the experience and the food.
Review: Captain Cook special Mr.Pounder beef is great with Jalapeno and garlic sauce. Patty was great. Juicy enough to make a mess. Spicy enough to make you cry. Place is nice for Hangouts. Chill ambient. Sky view is great. Price is 9/10 Worth the experience and the food.

Review Text: Best burger in the town so far with relatively low price. The Original Fikamoli burger is so juicy and cheesy on the top. Delighted to have such good taste of burger in Shimanto Squire Dhanmondhi. Thank you Captain Cook.

Review Text: We often go to Hakka Dhaka Baily Road and every time we go there we're always very pleased with their service. The quality of their food is excellent specially the mega platter, dumplings, hot wings and kulfi are mouth-watering delicious. Along with the food Hakka Dhaka Baily Road also has a very warm, friendly and inviting environment with excellent customer service. Specially I always appreciate Saim's service, who recently got promoted to branch manager. He has always pleased us a lot. Congratulations to him for his success, the staff working under him are also pretty good, Saim is managing his branch pretty well. Today Nahid's service also pleased us. It's an amazing restaurant with great food, me and my family love this place. Wishing them all the best.

Review Text: Very very disappointed with the food they provided. We took Classic platter (for 2 people - 1500 BDT). Egg fried rice was oily and soggy. Beef chili onion was horrible, burnt taste, too much sweet, very watery & unpalatable. Sweet and sour prawn was unpalatable also, very soggy prawn coating, too much sour and rubbery. Fried chicken pieces were very small. Worst platter experience I ever had. Definitely not recommending the Baily road branch.

Review Text: I always loved the food of Hakka Dhaka as I was visiting you from the very beginning I guess. But today for ones I thought of rating you 4 instead of 5. Review Text: Yesterday we had the Happy Meal for Tk 499 and it was a very satisfying lunch. The spicy taste is what I liked most and the quantity was sufficient. The kulfi was excellent. We also ordered the Seafood Platter for 4 for takeaway. When we sat down to eat we found there wasn't enough food for all 4 of us. The fried rice, noodles, wrapped prawns and whole baked fish was sufficient but there wasn't enough crab and squid. After I called and complained to the Manager, he sent complementary dishes of each. I am impressed by his prompt action and good customer service. happy to see such professionalism. Keep up the good work!

Review Text: Me and some of my friends had iftar here yesterday. First, I called up Hakka Dhaka Banani to make a reservation and they didn't answer my phone 5 times until someone picked up and hung up on me before I could even hear them! Then they started declining my calls after I called them again! (How rude!) I called them again with my home telephone line... And someone finally picked up and took the reservation. Unfortunately, all the tables inside were reserved and we had to sit ...outside. It's not that special outside... doesn't have a nice view or anything... just a bunch of plants to block the horrid view. And the people that usually sit there are smokers who have their iftar with a cigarette. My main problem was the noise outside. Cars were honking outside and it ruined the entire experience. My suggestion is that they should just convert that place into an indoor area. The food was alright... But a bit overpriced. The Ramadan platter was 4K for 4 people. I think for that amount, they could've thrown in some extra dishes. The noodles was just average... Everyone kept saying it was "cocola noodles" I hope they take notes and improve.

Review Text: This was my first time yesterday. Starters were great. The main course was dissapointing really for the set platter....chicken was in the refrigerator for too long.....the noodle wrapped prawn (the one I wanted to taste) was bland.... (can spice up the prawn a bit).The prawn veggie was good and so was the beef. Most dissapointing thing was that they don't keep soft drinks at normal temperature (wierd)....come on there are children!! The best thing about the restaurant are the waiters who are helpful but a bit helpless given the circumstances!!!

Review Text: Went there with family of 7 adults and 3 kids with out reservation. Before visiting I confirmed about reservation and they confirmed, it's not required. In the evening, specially on weekends, it's pretty crowded. Very friendly and helpful stuffs. Ordered 2 jumbo platter and some additional from menu. Noddle wrapped shrimp and honey barbecued chicken wings were great appetizer. Wonton and dumplings were also very tasty. ... Noddles and Mongolian chili beef are a bit spicy, not for kids. In general, food was really good. Jumbo platter for 4 is more than enough for 4 for sure. Service: 9/10 Food: 9/10 Ambiance: 7/10 Price: 8/10 Shall I visit again? DEFINITELY.

Review Text: Me and my wife went there on Baishakhi afternoon to take there Favorite meal (tk 499) meal platter during odd time. The platter was offered from 4.30 pm to 6.30 pm and we delayed our lunch just to have a taste of it. We thought to take the alternate options in our two platters so that we could have a chance to taste all the options. But when we went to order, the parser refused to give alternate options and replied that they do not take order for single platter. Even he repli...ed that if we ordered for single platter than they would refuse to serve so but it was not mentioned in anywhere in their flyer. The attitude of the parser was unfriendly. However we placed order. Then the manager came and roughly asked whats my problem. When i explained to him the issue, he became somewhat soft and said sorry. The food came. The rice and spaghetti became normal temperature and did not taste well. The mongolian beef and wrapped shrimp was good. Chicken mushroom was average. The special kulfi was good but not that much special... Overall FOOD was different, taste would be better if served hot, has areas of improvement.. Restaurant atmosphere and cleanliness was better.. But SERVICE is poor, promotional offers should be carefully designed, and the servers and managers should learn how to stay polite when they are in the wrong side of any debate... However I will go there/order online another day to get the taste of other items...
Review: Me and my wife went there on Baishakhi afternoon to take there Favorite meal (tk 499) meal platter during odd time. The platter was offered from 4.30 pm to 6.30 pm and we delayed our lunch just to have a taste of it. We thought to take the alternate options in our two platters so that we could have a chance to taste all the options. But when we went to order, the parser refused to give alternate options and replied that they do not take order for single platter. Even he repli...ed that if we ordered for single platter than they would refuse to serve so but it was not mentioned in anywhere in their flyer. The attitude of the parser was unfriendly. However we placed order. Then the manager came and roughly asked whats my problem. When i explained to him the issue, he became somewhat soft and said sorry. The food came. The rice and spaghetti became normal temperature and did not taste well. The mongolian beef and wrapped shrimp was good. Chicken mushroom was average. The special kulfi was good but not that much special... Overall FOOD was different, taste would be better if served hot, has areas of improvement.. Restaurant atmosphere and cleanliness was better.. But SERVICE is poor, promotional offers should be carefully designed, and the servers and managers should learn how to stay polite when they are in the wrong side of any debate... However I will go there/order online another day to get the taste of other items...

Review Text: Went there on their launching day at dhanmondi branch. I was the winner of their contest.so I got a platter of 1300tk completely free of 2people. Starting wid their service nd hospitality it was great I must say. The manager himself came to ensure the taste nd service to evry single customer. Coming to the taste of food, its awwwsmm... I loved the spicyness of Chinese foods.every single item was fingerrlicking typ good. Tummy khush !! Nd we ordered an xtra mineral water which they gave us free with the platter while paying for it. Over all it was GREAT experience wid Hakka Dhaka. Hope to visit again.

Review Text: The Hakka Chinese is mouth watering! Each dish made us feel droll. The smokey flavors of fried rice and noodles was very much appealing. Review Text: Ordered the PLATTER-B worth of 1300 for 2 person.. And here's what i think 1) Rock-hard beef. Review Text: No complain about food. Though the food was more on spicy side but taste was good. But you guys need serious improvement in your service and in your offerings. You don't follow what you preach! We were 11 people went to have lunch and picked your 299 set menu offer (circulated in your FB page). You had different options in the set like rice/noodles, beef/chicken etc. but the first thing you said everybody has to choose one item! why?? if so then why did you keep the options?? And later you denied 10% discount on women's day celebration which is clearly mentioned in your page. Very disappointing! These days people do talk/share. So you should be very cautious about it. Nobody will visit twice if you do not take care of your customers.
Review: No complain about food. Though the food was more on spicy side but taste was good. But you guys need serious improvement in your service and in your offerings. You don't follow what you preach! We were 11 people went to have lunch and picked your 299 set menu offer (circulated in your FB page). Review Text: I have been a regular at Hakka Dhaka ever since the very start of their venture with their small restaurant at Banani. Ever since the very beginning they realized the fact that they might be the "under-dog" of the industry which motivated them to provide the most superior value possible which kept me coming back time and again, but this favorite restaurant of mine disappointed me quite a bit the past couple of my visits. I believe that in order to maximize the value provided... to the customers, a good service is as crucial as good food. Even though their food remains to be fantastic, it's their service that continues to frustrate me. It really pains me to say this as one of the owners is a good acquaintance of mine but even though the management is absolutely top notch, their service providers (a.k.a. Waiters) has some of the most unsophisticated and un-professional attitude and this just keeps getting worse. It is not always possible for the management to engage the customers directly, hence it is these waiters who end up being the face of the restaurant and it is not a pretty face. Please do not take it as a sign of aggression but rather a constructive criticism from a fan of the place. I am posting this here instead of a third party forum (such as foodbank) in the hope that the management takes notice of this issue. Apologies for the rant. Regards, Faiz.

Review Text: Had dinner at Hakka Dhaka last night and simply loved it! The owner himself came over at the table to explain the menu & to suggest what we should order! Now that you don't see everyday! I'm definitely going back; and this time with more people!

Review Text: Chinese as it should be! The exterior of the shop reminded me of Chinatown in Leicester sq. and the food had the authenticity that most shops fail to deliver. The wings, crispy beef and prawns in particular, insanely good. And to go with it the pricing is reasonable. If the owners manage to keep the quality consistent and continue to give personal attention to customers, then Hakka Dhaka is definitely going places.

Review Text: I found it to be consistent. Went there on 25/2/17. It was probably my 3rd or 4th visit and the food quality remained good like before. Their chicken steak is something I crave for every single day. I tried their platter 'Epic Romance' and the chicken steak and the jumbo prawns were definitely highlight of the dish. The wedges were crispy on the outside, soft on the inside and the cheesy rice complimented the dish pretty well. I would also suggest their beef bento and their lemon chicken meal. Those are really good too.

Review Text: Love the place, the aesthetics, the food, and the service. In any aspect, one critical factor is style and originality; Treehouse has an abundance of it Ideal if you want to take someone out for a great meal and a meaningful conversation; the place itself is a great conversation starter Not ideal at all of you wanna skip class and go there for some "hanky-panky". You better stick to Argeela for it Be ready to spend about 1k-2k per person

Review Text: The restaurant is okay. The decor is decent. The stairs are totally unsafe. The menu... it has a lot of flaws. Starting with the lack of fizzy drinks to not being able to order extra sides. Not everyone wants to drink juice with a steak. I know I don't. I had to get those mini water bottles you all have that taste extremely bitter. Try to get Mum and some other mineral water brands since getting water is the only option for people who don't want those juices. Also what am I s...upposed to do if I want extra wedges? Order an entire lemon chicken platter for those 5 pieces of wedges that come with it? The menu is extremely inconvenient. The platters were decorated okay. Looked aesthetically pleasing. The wedges were the only decent sides. The rice was somewhat okay too. The mashed potato and mushrooms weren't up to the mark. I had expectations from this place and I am disappointed.

Review Text: I had visited this place before, and the first time was satisfactory and for the price, they have a standard and likable menu. But as I'm writing this now there's a notable callousness from their part which can be something anyone is likely to face trouble with. I have had dinner with my family yesterday and took three of their current iftar platters alongside one sea food platter from their usual menu. The food was nothing special but it didn't lack taste either. The icecrea...m that was with the iftar platter was melted though. However, the issue that occured is when we were provided with the bill, the sea food platter stated 1597tk (vat excl.) This was startling for us as in all their menues it had 597tk written on it. When heading out we pointed it out and they merely apologised. My concern is that it is a restaurant's responsibility to correctly and accurately list down information of every item. The customers decide on a menu weighting down on both the price and food combined, an error such as this does not only put the customers at inconvenience but is mainly very misleading.
Review: I had visited this place before, and the first time was satisfactory and for the price, they have a standard and likable menu. But as I'm writing this now there's a notable callousness from their part which can be something anyone is likely to face trouble with. I have had dinner with my family yesterday and took three of their current iftar platters alongside one sea food platter from their usual menu. The food was nothing special but it didn't lack taste either. The icecrea...m that was with the iftar platter was melted though. However, the issue that occured is when we were provided with the bill, the sea food platter stated 1597tk (vat excl.) This was startling for us as in all their menues it had 597tk written on it. When heading out we pointed it out and they merely apologised. My concern is that it is a restaurant's responsibility to correctly and accurately list down information of every item. The customers decide on a menu weighting down on both the price and food combined, an error such as this does not only put the customers at inconvenience but is mainly very misleading.

Review Text: This is regarding dining experience at Tree House last night(18th September 2015).I am disappointed that I could not see through the reviews before agreeing to go for dinner with friends and a one year four month old.We waited one and half hours for 3 chicken steak meals and 1 beef steak meal(there was just three options to choose from).I personally feel pricing should include the 'experience' and interior for dining out,if that is so,the pricing is high because the place is ...really really really congested.There was this loud group of boys celebrating a birthday or something,but as common sense is most uncommon these days,the small space did not affect them to share incidents about their lives as loudly as possible.The staff maybe well behaved but the waiting time for food was so dispiriting(food was served as soon as we got up to leave) that there are no pictures to share.Also, if the food was extremely exciting that would have been a totally different story.Anyway,maybe it was a bad day for me or maybe my expectations do not match the common good reviews about this place,I will never frequent this place again.

Review Text: In a city of bricks and concretes, yesterday I chose to be at a place like "Triangle cafe" for Iftar. The place is situated just beside 3/a Dhanmondi lake, if you're a nature lover like me then its the perfect place for enjoying the soothing weather and gentle breeze of this monsoon. Triangle had two platers, one with a rice bowl and the other offering chowmein. Being a chowmein lover I ordered plater 2 and I have to agree the food was great in quality and sufficient in quantity for one. The BBQ chicken is a must try and also the kebab roll was juicy and spicy. The chowmein tasted perfectly seasoned. Both the platers are priced 450/- BDT all inclusive. I will recommend everyone who is looking for an escape out of this city sensationalism, Triangle is your place to feel the nature and enjoy a quality time with mouthwatering food.

Review Text: Seeing the location felt good about the cafe but they were renovating so very few customers which is why asked if they will be able to serve and the staff replied yes. To our surprise they served old and smelly chicken in their BBQ set menu to both of my colleagues and burnt mushroom to me one by one with serving the third meal 40 mind after ordering. Upon complaining they discounted 37 or 47 taka from the bill silently, which only shows they knew what they were serving and still went along with it. Very disappointing. Won't visit again and will suggest my Peers to do the same.

Review Text: Went there yesterday. Decoration was good having a seperate family lounge. But there service was staggeringly poor. We ordered kacchi platter (5 persons) including chicken roast, beef tikka, firni, jarda and borhani. When the dishes came we discovered that there was no mutton in the kacchi!!! When called, the waiter told that it was a mistake and brought all the muttons together in a seperate bowl. Two pieces of mutton for each person and the pieces were very tiny. the firni was like baby food (semolina) and there was no raisin in it. Jarda was of no difference. Above all, the food quality was nowhere near the quality of the one in Rampura. only there ambience and the borhani compelled me to put a 2 star. otherwise I would have given a one.

Review Text: The venue comes with stunning view from the evening. Truly you get to see the lights of dhaka from a very unique perspective. Though the main open air zone does not benefit from the wind draft. On hot evenings that could be an issue. But all in all great place to hangout. Now here is the reason for scoring just 3 *s. Food. Not up to the mark. Mark of any good chef is his chicken fries. They will be exactly same texture taste and look wise every time under the supervision of t... Having said that, special corn soup that we ordered and the rice both were made top notch. Good job on that. As a round up mixed food rating resulted three stars.

Review Text: We ordered a lemonade and an Oreo frappe. The waiter told us that Oreo frappe wasn't available, but Oreo milkshake was(even though there was nothing like Oreo milkshake in the menu). So I ordered that. They took more than 20 minutes to serve. The lemonade tasted horrible. But the milkshake was worse. They didn't even use Oreo biscuits, moreover the biscuits tasted bitter. They used expired biscuits, I think. I couldn't even finish the whole thing. We complained about it, but they couldn't show us the packet of biscuits. Never gonna go to that place again.

Review Text: ItтАЩs burger greatness in the most primitive way, large enough to satisfy any hungry burger boy or girl, impossibly juicy and flavorful as can be. The cheese, Vermont Cheddar, adds the flavor it needs to, but could be more melted, although thatтАЩs a recurring problem with most burgers and the cheese that sits atop them in this city. The fries are delicious as well, golden, crispy and beautifully salty, what more do you want?
Review: ItтАЩs burger greatness in the most primitive way, large enough to satisfy any hungry burger boy or girl, impossibly juicy and flavorful as can be. The cheese, Vermont Cheddar, adds the flavor it needs to, but could be more melted, although thatтАЩs a recurring problem with most burgers and the cheese that sits atop them in this city. The fries are delicious as well, golden, crispy and beautifully salty, what more do you want?

Review Text: I have been a regular consumer at KFC Gulshan 1 outlet. Today I have encountered a strange approach from the cashier. I ordered 2 pcs crispy Chicken meal. He was struggling to understand and eventually ended up giving two packs of fries. I told him that ordered the meal, there should be one pack only. Then he said you ordered 2 pcs of chicken. I explained it's the meal that I ordered. He was going back and forth... He seemed confused. I told a trainee standing next to him to ...call someone senior, the manager so that I can explain. She told the cashier instead. And he got agitated. He showed the fries pack and started saying you ordered 2 pcs chicken. The guy standing to him stepped in and took my order. He remained silent as he exchanged the cards... no thanks or apology for the confusion... nothing. To make it worse... he came upstairs after a while to clean up and kept exchanging eye contact couple of times. Don't want to put his name in public. Would be happy to inbox.

Thanks kfc Bangladesh.

Review Text: Best steak, served fresh. poutine was also very tasty.
Review: Best steak, served fresh. poutine was also very tasty.

Review Text: Went there last Friday with my friend, got surprised a bit seeing such a small place. Upon arrival they waiter attended us with details of their menu as they prepare steaks in two types of Texas style with some deviations. We selected a Sirloin and Tomahawk, which were 300g and 500g. The truth is we were a bit skeptic about the weight they were mentioning but to our surprise they showed us the raw steaks that they were about to prepare for us. This was a nice touch. Liked the... way they ask customers approval for the cuts before preparing it as they were doing it for all the guests in other tables too. After waiting for around 30 mins, the steaks arrived. We ordered medium done and medium rare the steaks were exactly like we ordered. The medium rare Tomahawk tasted even better than my medium done Sirloin. Both the steaks had sof juicy center with flavorful seared crusts. Loved every bite of the tender steak till the end. The portion is quite hefty along with the sides of mashed potato and sautee vegetables. The sauces were nice compliment to the steak, would recommend their roast bacon glace for sure. This will be my steak place from now on for as long as they serve steaks like that.

Review Text: First glimpse will depict a small cozy diner bustling with energy as I have been there at dinner time. Fortunately we got our seats as we reserved earlier that day through phone. Ordered a Ribeye and Sirloin which were 300g each as per menu and done in true Texas style, which I was a bit skeptic at first. Then to my surprise they bought the raw cut in front of us and asked if we liked the cut and marbling. This is something we never experience in any steakhouse before, no one... asks about marbling of the meat in any steakhouse so far I have visited in Bangladesh. I started loving the place form that moment as the Ribeye had very good marbling in it. Just after that they served us complementary corn soups which were good gesture from their behalf and it was good too. Had to wait nearly 25 mins before we got the food and my friend asked the waiter why it takes this long to serve, then we came to know about the smoking process. They actually smoke each and every steak with imported woodchips and when we asked if they could show us the woodchips they certainly did, mixture of dry Apple & Hickory woodchips! Finally the steaks arrived and wow, perfectly seared medium rare steaks with juicy slight red center and dark crust outside. The first bite actually depicted all about that smoking stuff and for real it felt like I having a real steak, which I have seen for so long in TLC and other TV shows. The perfect thickness, sides of mashed potato and amazing sauces, though I did not like to use sauce in steaks as they are supposed to be juicy for medium rare done and in this case it was. Their service was good too as the waiters were polite and knowledgeable. This is my new favorite place for steaks and would highly recommend if anyone is looking for thick cut juicy steaks in Dhaka.

Review Text: *** Negative review *** I was in love with Woodhouse Grill, seeing all their positive reviews and the amazing looking steaks. But all that glitters was just eye washing for us. We ordered one tomahawk, two sirloin and one t-bone steak. All were medium rare. And we rarely tasted steak like those. It was absolute raw and chewy like a tire. Only one sirloin steak came out good that means they can make the steak worth it's money but messed up with other three. After complaining t...hey heated that again but we were even unable to cut it . Highly dissatisfied and disappointed. Place - Wood house grill Food rating - 2 ( for that one steak )

Review Text: In recent times, I've tasted many dishes but none has come close to the taste and deliciousness of the steaks of this place. The steak piece is so tender and juicy, meat juice literally comes out when you cut a piece of the steak. The side dishes with the steak are also delicious specially the sauces. The sauses enhanced the flavor of the steak. Review Text: Basically I like steak very much and I had it at different restaurants in Dhaka. But what I had today in Woodhouse Grill, simply awesome. It's the ultimate place a steak lover should visit. Their environment is very nice & clean and excellent service staffs although space is low comparing to other restaurants. Price is a little bit expensive but I found it worthy when I tasted the steak...its size, tenderness erc. Overall its a good restaurant to visit.

Price is a little bit expensive but I found it worthy when I tasted the steak...its size, tenderness erc. Overall its a good restaurant to visit.

Review Text: A great collection of prime cuts. The sides were not all that good. I'll recommend the mushroom and grilled vegetables as sides. But hey need some serious work on doneness. We ordered two medium rare rib eyes. Although the cuts were nice and thick one was way too rare the other way too well done. The searing was good. The drinks were chilled. Appetizers were great. Will come again.
Review: A great collection of prime cuts. The sides were not all that good. I'll recommend the mushroom and grilled vegetables as sides. But hey need some serious work on doneness. We ordered two medium rare rib eyes. Although the cuts were nice and thick one was way too rare the other way too well done. The searing was good. The drinks were chilled. Appetizers were great. Will come again.

Review Text: As a beef lover, I loved the steak and the steak loved me back
Review: As a beef lover, I loved the steak and the steak loved me back

Review Text: I went to Woodhouse Grill on Friday and was shocked to see such a small restaurant with no space between tables. It seems the tables are joining each other. Their prices are quite expensive considering that this is a very small restaurant in a small congested space. The service was poor. We were told that the food would arrive 45 mins. after ordering but the food arrived later. I suggested the owner to serve all the food together at a time instead of serving each order separ...ately. We ordered a t bone steak medium well which was brought out medium rare with blood remaining inside. We also ordered a sirloin medium well which was very dry. The steaks are kept frozen and after cooking it was not at all juicy. We also ordered grill chicken which was ok. The waiters are not well trained and don't know when to serve the drinks which should have arrived right after ordering but instead I had to remind the waiter yo bring out the drinks almost 30 mins. after ordering the drinks. Its a ok place but they need to improve service quality and better quality steak.

Review Text: It's 4.5/5 actually. I want to say "I loved it" but minute details are holding me back. "I really liked it!" aptly describes it. Flavorful, tender, almost perfectly cooked ribeye and sirloin (5/5 for those) but t-bone was on the dry side. All sauces were on point though. (I'd recommend the hollaindase, pepper and bacon glaze hands down.) This place is a refreshing and much needed whiff of fresh air in the Dhaka steak situation. Definitely worth a try. I'm definitely going back (for the sirloin я┐╜) Also, 5/5 for hospitality. я┐╜

Review Text: I had the Tomahawk steak last week. It looked incredible but tasted disaster. I asked for medium but they cooked well done for me. Their service was good as they cooked a new one but for my utter disappointment the second one was medium rare. Both the time the meat was really chewy and the mash was too sweet. The place is too small and congested. They should work hard on improving their cooking of the steak.

Review Text: The steak was fresh, tender and perfectly cooked while the sauces added a rich savoury flavour. The appetisers were delightfully different. With a friendly staff and a very cordial owner who personally checks up on the quality of food being served, Woodhouse Grill is a must visit for those who want to enjoy delicious steaks.

With a friendly staff and a very cordial owner who personally checks up on the quality of food being served, Woodhouse Grill is a must visit for those who want to enjoy delicious steaks.

Review Text: Went to Woodhouse Grill today. Already I had an Experience about the Steak in Bangladesh. So as usual with timid heart and boosted morale entered to the venue. Little small but neat and clean.....the employees are very cordial...soft spoken and well trained. They I have seen describing the customers in detail about the type of cut, dish and side dishes. I have met the owner little latter. He was also very cordial and helpful. To taste for the 1st time....I asked for a Pepper ...Steak and level of cooking I asked is Medium well done. I received the food and cut the piece of meat....the knife was smooth and I put the first piece in my mouth.....mmmmm....delicious.....but the cooking was Well Done. The owner observed my food and he was not satisfied with the cooking level, he returned my steak back and served another steak cooked in perfection as Medium Well Done. The incident depict how sincere and customer oriented they are. I am fully satisfied and wish to go frequently there. If the remain committed regarding their standard and customer satisfaction no doubt they will rise above the horizon....Viva Woodhouse Grill. I definitely recommend to taste the steak in Woodhouse Grill.

Review Text: In our visit, they served absolutely tender and juicy steaks, with well cooked grilled vegetables, real steak sauce and a bonus butter sauce! Everything was cooked to perfection. After you place the order they show you the pieces of meats/cuts - which is a great thing for the real steak lovers. The owner himself gave us briefs about all the steaks, making yourself clear about the one you are ordering. In summary, a perfect steakhouse with original recipe - highly recommended for real steak lovers!

Review Text: Had a bad experience at FoodBuzz banasree. Yesterday I went there with my family. As all the tables were filled up we waited for some time. Then one table was empty and the waiter accommodated us that table. But a little while later when we were about to order food the waiter came and said this table was booked and we must leave it. They wanted us to give another table but there was no Air Conditioning there. So we had to leave the restaurant. Before leaving I told the incident to the man sitting in cash counter. But none of them simply apologized for it. Its only because of traffic jam and lack of good restaurants in banasree, we have visit such third class restaurants who do not even know what is customer service. This was my first and last visit to this restaurant.

Review Text: Service was pretty slow to start with. And they do not have everything like they say they have on the menu. We took chicken cashew nut salad as well as Thai fried rice, which were good, as well as their buffalo wings. But the beef sizzling that we ordered was pretty much burnt as the bottom part of the dish was clearly overcooked, unlike the almost undercooked top half. Nonetheless, they have good menu and a clean environment. Hope they improve more.

Review Text: Thanks to #foodbuzz for making a special day тАШSuper SpecialтАЩ! Today I want to express my gratitude to foodbuzz who unconditionally helped me create a special memory! I wanted to give a surprise to my special one on our Aniversiry.The initial plan was to gather at foobuzz with all our friends and spend a nice time together. But I wasnтАЩt sure if the people from there would cooperate without any booking or any charge. So I called at the number from their Facebook page and I was surprised instead at the enthusiasm and willingness they showed.There isnтАЩt much I can do to repay them but I at least wanted to thank them here and inform people about their hospitality

Review Text: Place : #foodbuzz ok so before I start rating their food and service and what not let me start off by saying what they did right that other restaurants usually don't. 1st - The food actually looks as they were advertised. 2nd - They actually served the food hot, yes you heard it right "HOT" this is where a lot of restaurant fails. They served all the food at the right time and in right order. ok now let's move on to what you guys really care about. Items -9/10 :kabsha, chusanut salad. Taste -9/10: I don't believe in perfection but this came pretty close, I would still rate it 9 but I gave 10 for a reason and I'll explain that in a bit. So anyway the chusanut salad really hot when it was served and it was tasty as well. Every item on that platter was upto the mark. Sorry I don't know the name of all the items otherwise I would've explained each item by their taste. Quantity: [10/10]: I don't know how much you can eat but I can eat a lot and I can tell you it's more than enough for 4 person.

We tried smoke chicken pizza, classy supreme pizza, classy chicken pasta, chicken chowmin and american chopsuey... seriously all foods were just too good... nd it's called 'poysha ushul'... most importantly their behaviour was very well. we were pleased with all the things.

Review Text: Update about the Rating: This was one of my favorite place for hanging out with fnf. But faced something awkward and irritating in my last visit. Totally unprofessional behavior, if there's some problem to serve a specific item to me then it's better not to serve the same item to other while I am in your restaurant. I tried to order a specific item but the server said this item is not available, ok cool. I have gone for another item. but a Minute later I could see and hear t...hey were taking the same item's order from the next table. I didn't want to complain about the mismanagement at the cafe as some other visitor was there, I thought it would be better If I write it down to their complain book, so I asked for their complain book but they don't have a feedback or complain book. OMG. Rather the server insisted me to complain the problem to him directly, I denied and later the manager or accountant came to explain the scenario. Now come to the food part: I had ordered "Schezwan Chicken, Rice" and "Mongolian Beef" where the quantity was really poor and it doesn't even close to Schezwan Chicken's look or taste. Mongolian Beef's beef was hard to chew and again quantity was poor too. Old Rating: I will recommend this place to have the Fresh Juice and French Fries there. Reasonable price and comfortable couches to hang out with Friends. All the Other items I have tried need more improvement (Burger, Sub Sandwich and Regular Sandwich).

Review Text: Visited Chill! Chinese for the first time as guests while visiting from UK. Lovely ambiance & decor. Cuisine was lovely and variety of choices and as didn't have duck for few years, the "flaming duck" dish caught my eye but a bit disappointed as the duck was mostly bones and what little meat I sampled tasted a little, how can I describe it, a little off! Otherwise, family with kids thoroughly enjoyed it & staff were friendly! We HIV(%Co%%ope to visit again soon next time we are on Bangldesh.

Review Text: Last week I ordered few items from here. The food items were Polaw, Elish fry, beef fry, prawn curry, rui bhuna and chicken roast, for 6 person. Ami raat 12 tay order place kori and got them on the same day around 7.30 p.m, just on time. They are very responsive to reply their customer. Now, about the food, each and every items were so delicious. Protita khabar eto fresh chilo j khwar somoy amar feel hocchilo egulo bazaar theke kena suru kore ranna kora khubi jotno ebong antorikotar sathe kora hoyeche. Now, the bestest part is, apu amake amar order er sathe 6 pots Jorda and 1 pot extra polaw as token of love send korechen. It touched my heart <3 Food - 110/100 Service - 10/10 Behaviour - 10/10

Review Text: Outrageous increase in prices. Mejo options for Chas are gone. A cha will now cost 120. Add ons to Wraps have been reduces. The portions have decreased. This all with ever deteriorating service. Extremely disappointing that a store with so much potential of creating a difference is now becoming an undifferentiated commercial business. This WAS my go to place for lunch. (Mejo wrap and Cha). Will be looking at other options where 400 taka can be spent on food and service (and doesnt operate from a market with poor seating options given how much I have to spend).

Review Text: I was looking for a quick breakfast after returning from a 2 day road trip with friends, and thought I would give Peyala a try. Had their breakfast burger and mango cooler. Both were outstanding I must say. Staff are friendly and eager to help. My order was takeaway, interior looked cozy during my brief stay there. Very few restaurants in Bangladesh were able to pleasantly surprise me on first visit. This is one of them. Highly recommend.

Review Text: Yesterday was my first visit here & it was not a pleasant one. I had to wait over 35mins for one masala chai & the place was relatively empty. Even worse, a person who ordered the tea much later than I did, received it earlier. The cafe in itself reminded me of a smaller version of Chipotle and the prices were reasonable. However, the efficiency of the staff were simply not up to the mark & I honestly expected better service.

Review Text: The place is clean and the staff are very friendly , however I believe the management is very stingy. Most of the menus were 6 pieces ( pen corrected from 8.) instead of 8 pieces. The beef and chicken vegetable - are shamelessly small quantity and flooded with gravy to fill the plate. I have never seen such a Chinese dish with Indian curry like gravy and small portions . The manager might be trying to save money to have higher bonus . I believe any restaurant inspector will... Despite specifically requested for little or no chilies- the foods were served with red and green chilies and when complained they waived the price of ice cream (5 out of 10). I would spend my money some where else next time.

Review Text: Had the pleasure of visiting this restaurant on my short, but memorable trip to Dhaka almost two summers ago. The environment is clean and neat unlike the dark, dimly lit restaurants found lurking all over Dhaka city. The food and service were absolutely divine. Coming to Dhaka I realized nothing is truly authentic, you are expected to run into the fusions here. This restaurant takes the hat in asian fusion food. The exotic looking menu and the fresh quality food here was something remembered from my South Asia tour. Congratulations to the restaurant on holding their standard high over the course of the years. Locals say it's been around for more than 20 years and it shows in their service! I look forward to coming back and try those crabs again!

Review Text: Worst than the worst Iftar platter I had yesterday with my colleagues at Gulshan 1 branch and none of them said anything different. when u complain about their food they'll tell you that they maintain food quality religiously in this month of Ramadan. Everyone likes food to be served hot, u don't need to remind that to your customer. Accept that you are of no good quality, there are plenty other good coffee shops in the town. We eat the food not the franchise. Iftar platter... had bland chicken hariyali kebab, fish fritters were way too much fried and cold, spicy grilled chicken with the friend rice was actually without any spice. I am sorry to say it was overall tasteless. Coleslaw with the chicken lemon oli was sour and inedible. I always had good expectations on GJ regarding food but you guys just did a very bad job in this month of Ramadan. Couldn't resist myself to make a point on it. Hope you guys will work on it.

Review Text: I have been a regular customer of Gloria Jean's of Gulshan 1 and Gulshan 2 branches, since there opening at Dhaka, Bangladesh.Their caramel machiato, chillers and chiken lollipops are my all time favourites, but today It has happened. my love for gloria jeans has crossed the sky limit. I went on Gulshsn 1 branch, ordered my favourite Machiato, bought a RA mug and left it there. I contacted with them and told what happened and later there was an awesome person from that branch... named Shahid who assured me that he found the mug and asked me to collect it from the cash counter. I have told the details of the person who will collect it instead of me and guess what, i got back my mug, just because of the awesome people who are working in Gulshan 1 branch and ready to serve their customers with utmost pleasure anytime. #LovedyourService #LoveforGloriaJean's

Review Text: Might want to teach your staff a thing or two about customer service.They treat their customers like low life.. The staff themselves don't speak proper English and they have the audacity to hint at a paying customer to order in English! let me tell you something I am a Canadian born citizen to a WHITE Canadian father whose mother is a Proud Bengali.. I don't need your stupid staff to blabber in their grammatically incorrect English with a funny accent. I just wanted to practice ordering in Bengali since the location of this coffee franchise was in Bangladesh! The coffee itself wasn't too bad although not too special given the price ! Won't be coming back and won't recommend my fellow Canadians to visit either. Coffee I can make at home, it's the atmosphere that I wanted to enjoy !

Review Text: Gloria Jean's Coffees Bangladesh- it's a coffee shop where coffee tastes horrible and other dishes taste quite well. They don't even concentrate on improving the taste of the Coffees. They are constantly trying to improve other dishes which are easily found in other "restaurants". I repeat "Restaurants". Last I checked Gloria jeans is not a restaurant, it's a coffee shop. My question is- Has Gloria jeans become a restaurant or is it still a coffee shop? You guys are selling... deserts, fried rice, burgers and many other things very efficiently and they taste quite good as well. But when it comes to your coffee, they taste like shit. I have been going there for a long time and it's unacceptable from a great coffee shop like this one. I have been going to various coffee shops for a long time and that's how I developed a keen taste for Coffees. I know the variations of Coffees and the taste of them. In other coffee shops, the variations of coffee is quite amazing. Here one day I ordered "cafe mocha" and it tasted as usual. The next time I went there, I ordered a "cappuccino". I couldn't even differentiate between those two because both of them tasted the same. There is no depth and aroma in these coffees. If I can't find the variations among the different types of Coffees, then why the hell anyone should come here to taste these horrible Coffees with such high prices? They certainly maintain a standard about other dishes and they taste really good. But as a coffee shop, they don't deserve to get a rating of 1.

They certainly maintain a standard about other dishes and they taste really good. But as a coffee shop, they don't deserve to get a rating of 1.

Review Text: I went there yesterday. It was a busy time. I ordered Steam rice with Steam chicken for me and Grilled chicken for my friend. Unfortunately both chicken were cold but part of the grilled chicken was very cold. I ordered Latte and at last but to be honest it was cold as well. the Waiters need to be little bit more trained as I was looking for them at least 7-10 mins to clean my table and also they should have some knowledge about the food. Overall I can not give more than 3 star this time. Hope next time I will have a more good experience. Thanks
Review: I went there yesterday. It was a busy time. I ordered Steam rice with Steam chicken for me and Grilled chicken for my friend. Unfortunately both chicken were cold but part of the grilled chicken was very cold. I ordered Latte and at last but to be honest it was cold as well. the Waiters need to be little bit more trained as I was looking for them at least 7-10 mins to clean my table and also they should have some knowledge about the food. Overall I can not give more than 3 star this time. Hope next time I will have a more good experience. Thanks

And addition to that the always smiling co-owners of this outstanding rooftop will make you come here again.

So whr do i start. Been half an hour nd um writing this. Order placed at 7 28 pm Mountain dew... Net bdt 760 token 93 july 3 At 7 55 they gave me the chicken pop nd said thryll give the rest in 5 mins. After 5 mins they sent the shake. 8 pm. Meanwhile we were 2 of us. We were done with the chicken pop by 8 20 nd at 8 25 they sent the coleslaw nd burger. It looked terribly funny that yet they dint give the wings. What m i supposed to have the coleslaw with . Your head? I finished the burger at 8 35ish ns went to the counter asking them bbq wings kothay. They said 7 more mins. I said ill take take away nd asked them to take back their coleslaw. They agreed. But when they took it back the waiter said sorry aita khawa. I said impossible. U have to take it back. If necessary pack the wings with a mountain dew. But what will i do with ur ckoslaw served this late with burger. Keu ki burger diye coleslaw khabe. ? Ok finally they agreed again. When i was leaving with the bbq wings nd mountain dew. They offered a 25 tk exchange. I said keep it. And very rudely they said no i wont keep ur money. Take it. I angrily said i wont nf statted to walk away. 3 ppl near the kitchen screamed at me saying never come back. Now let me ratw ur food. Shake was ok. 9/10 Burger was disgusting. 2/10 Chicken pop was 5/10 Um yet to have the wings but ur horrible experience wont allow me to digest ur food. I am never coming back nd i know it wont bother you. Thing is. The person i went at your place with said quite a few times to go nf sit sumwhr nd i replied na its a good place naam shunsi. Baki gular naam o shuninai. I wont ask ppl not to go thr. I will ask ppl to go to ur place for some beautiful experience . Cheers. If the owner sees this. The food can be skipped. Please maintain behaviour of ur chef nd waiters.

The first glance of the place with its magnificent Lebanese inspired decorations immediately gave out an impression of the middle east. Simple yet subtle. The moment I took a bite of the kabab, I felt like I was back in the Arabian peninsula. The soft arabian music and the lightings and ofcourse the humble waiters dressed in the finest attires helped to complement the feel I suppose. They really did deliver the so called Arab "ZAYKA". If nothing else the chefs of this place are some of the finest artists in the world. A 5 star rating would not suffice to describe the experience. I offer them my compliments and look forward to their future endeavours.
I just love this place . nd the food was too good.

First of all the decoration of the place is too beautiful. It increases with the Lebanese songs. The food we ordered was happy hour set menu which was so delicious specially the chicken mushroom curry and rice. Quantity was also good for single person. The sauce needs to be better as it was slight spicy. Chicken was average. The behaviour of the staffs was not good that I experienced. I found them kinda rude. When we were selecting the food from the menu they immigrated showed us another menu and said may be we could not afford that. That was so insulting though we all stayed there to taste the food. Overall the experience was good except the behaviour of the staffs.
Definitely authentic Arabian foods, loved the ambience. Anyone who loves Arabian must try out this place
Finally I loved your Iftar platter. The place is welcoming with quality service. Keep it up! :)
the food was worth every single penny.behaviour was commendable as well.overall a good place to go with family & friends.

I'm not sure why but word around town is that this place sucks. It definitely doesn't. The kebab items, especially the shish tawuq was quite good. Condiments were nice. There was no reason to go here, specifically, as my friend and I were both on a tight schedule. He had come on a return visit to his homeland from America, and wanted to meet up, after 12 years (for him) and 20 years for me.. also looking for a place near his old house where he grew up. It was just beyond! Meeting a friend after 20 years can be a very, very surreal experience, and I am quite glad that Al-Amar helped to enclose those memories.
If you really want to taste Arabian food then this is the right place

We placed an order over the phone for takeaway and were told that food would be ready in approximately 35 mins. I went after 45 mins to pick up the food and it still wasn't ready. I had to wait another 10 mins for them to prepare the parcel. Other than this setback, let's get into the food review: 1) Lamb Kabseh, priced at 645++. The meat & rice were cooked well and the portions were sufficient for 2 (provided you take some appetizers). However, I did not really like the over...whelming tomato taste. I prefer a drier kabseh with bigger portions of meat and garlic sauce but that's just my opinion. I'd rate this 2.5/5. Since it's quite pricey, I don't really recommend this. 2) Hommos, priced at 325++. Although this may sound too expensive for just mashed chickpeas with a bit of oil and mild seasoning, trust me it's worth it. Portions are more than enough to share for 2 (you can even take this for 3). Also, you can get extra bread for 20 taka each if you do run out of bread. I'd rate this 4/5. Highly recommended. 3) Lahem Bi Ajin, priced at 300++. These are mini beef keema pizzas which taste fantastic!!! Initially I was expecting a gravy dish because the description says 'marinated minced beef cooked with spices & tomatoes the traditional way' and was kinda bummed out when I saw mini pizzas but once I took a bite, I was blown away. They also give you a slice of yellow lemon (proper imported yellow lemon, and not the crap we get here which are being passed off as lemons) which adds so much to the flavor of the dish. 5/5, I'd have this everytime I go there. And since you get 8 slices, it's superb value for money for 2 people. My total bill was 1537 BDT (including 6% service charge and 15% VAT). I am quite confused as to why I had to pay service charge for a takeaway order, they definitely should remove that. Otherwise, it's not too heavy on the pocket for something different (provided you don't take the kabseh).

The place is clean and the staff are very friendly , however I believe the management is very stingy. Most of the menus were 6 pieces ( pen corrected from 8.) instead of 8 pieces. The beef and chicken vegetable - are shamelessly small quantity and flooded with gravy to fill the plate. I have never seen such a Chinese dish with Indian curry like gravy and small portions . The manager might be trying to save money to have higher bonus . I believe any restaurant inspector will... reject this ( if there is a licensing authority -unfortunately there is none ) . Despite specifically requested for little or no chilies- the foods were served with red and green chilies and when complained they waived the price of ice cream (5 out of 10). I would spend my money some where else next time.

Environment is good, food is also tasty but you need to give more attention on your service quality, waiters are not available when we need, even they have no combination in giving service, 3-4 waiters are giving service in one table other peopleтАЩs are waiting, so you need to much improve in management, Otherwise it was pretty good я┐╜я┐╜

Had the pleasure of visiting this restaurant on my short, but memorable trip to Dhaka almost two summers ago. The environment is clean and neat unlike the dark, dimly lit restaurants found lurking all over Dhaka city. The food and service were absolutely divine. Coming to Dhaka I realized nothing is truly authentic, you are expected to run into the fusions here. This restaurant takes the hat in asian fusion food. The exotic looking menu and the fresh quality food here was something remembered from my South Asia tour. Congratulations to the restaurant on holding their standard high over the course of the years. Locals say it's been around for more than 20 years and it shows in their service! I look forward to coming back and try those crabs again!
Environment and food was awesome.

As I'm writing this review it's breaking my heart that my favorite restaurant's quality has fallen so much...the other day I ordered 'palak paneer and aloo paratha..n palak paneer was rotten...I informed you about that...n today I m at your place and we face almost same situation. We ordered 1 khichuri thali and one Naan thali and one chicken butter masala. ... 1) khichuri thali: shockingly there was a hair in khichuri! !! My pregnant sis was craving for your khichuri..we or...dered 2 hours before we reach tarka so that we can get the khichuri thali...and that's what she get??? Amazing! There was another time I got hair on my salad but I overlooked it..but today! !! Anyway. ..now the bhortas. ..whenever we ordered khichuri thali we got Taki machher bhorta. .. and today we got tasteless, flooded with mustard oil alu bhorta which we weren't informed before. .when my sis asked the waiter he gave a lame explanation that is 'amra ekekdin ekek bhorta dei' how come we never got any other bhorta!! Lameness er limit thake..if you ran out of food..you could inform us!!and the Kala bhuna...we requested that the last timewe orderedit was so hard that we could hardly eat..n today..it was just same!! UNEXPECTED 2) Naan thali: I ordered garlic Naan..they served plain Naan...when I complain they replaced it with garlic Naan..it it was hard and cold...though they heat it..it was hard...I don't know what happened to tarkas that Naan. ..which used to melt in mouth....everything in the thali was cold. ..daal was more like home made daal chorchori...n palak paneer. ..saltless. ..tasteless. ..it didn't even had the buttery texture it used to have....DISAPPOINTED 3)chicken butter masala : taste was good...but the ratio according to price is very very poor..I tried chicken butter masala before but I had no idea that your restaurant serves it with minced chicken. Anyway...your restaurant was our favorite place..but after having back to back horrible experience. ..my n my family quit...we are never coming back. ..highly dissatisfied and hurt. ..all the best

There was a time not long ago when the choice for good authentic Indian restaurant in Dhaka was limited to Sajna and Khazana only, and then came Tarka with their mind blowing "never tasted" authentic Indian menu in a casual yet classy ambiance. So far I have tried all of their lunch thalis (except Veggie and Rice, as I am not much into those), and from their regular menu mutton hyderbadi biriyani, chicken lagawab makhani, beef boti, chickten tikka, khusnama kabab, daal butter... fry, matar paneer, mughal chicken, kashmiri/butter/garlic nan and I can't rank anyone better than the other as for their quality is 5 star. As for the drinks my favorite is Jeera Pani. It's also good to see that their service level has drastically improved since their inception and now I don't mind paying the 7% service charge. Also a nice addition was their Iftar menu during Ramadan and particularly the 'haleem' which I fell in love after first sip. I have intentionally held off my review until now as I wanted to test them over time for their consistency which they have proved so far. Keep up the great taste & service and wish you all the best in the business.
Food was really good and quantity was also good in term of price. Environment was quite impressive.
loved all the food...excellecent...(y)

I will definitely come back again... specially for the complimentary drinks... haha.... I can still taste it! ^_^

Service is poor. Food served in cold condition. Thali is just waste of money. I recommend not to go.

Now comes to food review, it very rare nowadays the food you have ordered in a resutarant and later all of them comes as a bomb of delicouse food! today i have lunch here, food and service were excellent, hydrabadi biriani, malai chicken, beef bhuna was great but the king was achari mutton and kulfi. only weak link was lucknow chicken biriani which was a bit dry, yet your all other dishes were so fine and waiters are very friendly that i would love visit there again and again.

Just walked out from your restaurant an will never ever step into your place. Me my mother and Khala come to have lunch every month. But your service turned out to be horrible. In the mean time we saw ( as we sat in from of the kitchen door) a lady in burka , most probably she was one o your staff members and her son walked in to the kitchen. Really bad experience. I ordered a masala dosa and pani puri. My wife ordered a beef roll. The food was taking a while so we decided to order some take away as well while waiting. The first served me the dosa while not serving anything to my wife. The dosa was hard like crystallized caramel! While we started eating the dosa we asked for the remaining orders. After about ten minutes they came back with the pani puri. I finished my meal while my wife was still waiting for her beef roll which arrived even after the take away food was ready. To add to all this misery regarding the service, the food was horrible. Not worth the time, anxiety, or money. Not going back unless the entire serving staff is changed or trained properly. The chefs need some training as well.

1. The crust was really thin, almost like a Ruti. 2. Amount of cheese was not bad. 3. Among the toppings, tomatoes and onions were abundant, there was hardly any chicken even masroom in the chicken supreme pizza. You can also count the olives. 4. The overall taste was good but for 279tk, considering the toppings, it was overpriced. The making of pizza in an oven in front of you is the main attention. You can give it a try but not really a place to go back just to have the pizza. Definitely overhyped and overrated. Best of luck.

Well as i was born and bought up in this area I had basically tried all kinds of food around this place...so not gonna lie.... Now about pizza....i basically like it cause the crust the flavor all of it is good like if u expect to have a real pizza there are other places for that this pizza is for people who eats outside regularly and want some good food in a cheap rate.This is why i said good instead of 'soo good' Told ya not gonna lie About the place and environment - it's ...a street food court so it's under the open sky.You can bring hr friends and family and have a good time.And as usual there are some overly attached couples who comes here & makes us uncomfortable, i guess if u are not a hypocrite u wouldn't put the blame on this place. In the end all i have to say about this place is "places with good food and environment is not that available .But this place is all of it " я┐╜я┐╜я┐╜

Well the crust was really thin, almost felt Like a Nun Ruti. Amount of cheese was okay. Among the toppings, tomatoes and onions were abundant in the beef pizza. Portion of beef is again okay though there was hardly any chicken in the chicken pizza. You can also count the olives. The overall taste was good for 200tk. But considering the toppings, 200 tk is not cheap rather an okay price tag. They only have 8 inch pizzas. For a guy like me, I could easily eat Two and go for ...a kacchi afterwards. (Not Kidding). You can give it a try but not really a place to go back just to have the pizza. Great try though. Cheers.

The best place to have authentic Japanese food. Fresh food with great taste. The presentation of food is really nice. I would recommend this place for fine dining.
Their foods are best in town till date. The ambiance and the behavior of servers are good as well! Highly recommended :)

Fine dining? eh? Very own app? Using some garbage 3rd party app that's not even built for a specific restaurant. Does not work properly. Has so many bugs. And finally, takes 5 minutes to place an order...and then someone has to accept it from Umai...which nobody does. 10 minutes wasted lmao. 25% discount if order through app? But only for one item in cart! Ordered Chicken Karaage. Came without any Soy sauce. Dry af tiny crispy chicken without any taste. Next up Umai Special Creamy Salmon Roll and another Salmon Roll. Big in names; tiny in sizes. Yuuuge in prices. Have had these types of foods in many other places but yours are by far the worse in taste, size but super high on the price. Your 1300tk stuff is worth at most 400tk. I don't mind paying 1.3k or even 2k for a few pieces of rolls. But the food quality has to match, right?
Just love their food. Environment is peaceful.

Love this place! They are a fine dining establishment, with really great food, great service and, as expected, a hefty price tag against every item available. Despite of the feeling of despair I get whilst paying the bill, I still managed to go there a number of times, and haven't been disappointed once However, my latest visit was yesterday, and this time around, I faced a serious problem which prompted me to write this review. We ordered "Beef Udon Noodles" which is a fav...orite of my wife, and at the very end of the dish, we found some coiled strings. These things definitely came from the wired sponges that are used for scrubbing the plates when a dish washer is not available. So the person who cleaned the plates wasn't competent, and the chef was not vigilant enough to check this before serving the dish. It wasn't a big deal, but we had a bad feeling. We kind of lost our appetite, and called in the waiter to tell this to his manager. Knowing Bangladeshi restaurants, we weren't hoping for much. However, the manager came in almost running, and profusely apologized. He wanted to replace the dish. But by then, we were full and didn't have the appetite to eat more. So I refused. Then the manager told us that he will remove the bill for the noodles, and we can have any main dish from the menu for free. When I said we are no longer hungry, he said we can also have it made for "take away". By then, I was quite surprised. I haven't really seen such behavior from any other restaurant in Dhaka. But then again, I also did not find strings in the food in any other restaurant. But that is not really the point, the point is the nice gesture shown by Umai. After declining this generous offer, the manager seemed sad and apologized again and left. After 4-5 minutes, I asked for the bill, and the waiter informed that we will be served complimentary desserts and then the bill will be given. This was something I could not refuse. So me, my wife and child totally enjoyed the free Banana Katsu dessert (which was the most expensive dessert in the menu) and came out with a satisfied mind. I hope they continue this kind of customer service and improve the kitchen vigilance. I wish them all the best as I want them to stick around and keep on serving us high quality Japanese food.
Just love this place...peaceful environment..excellent service and well behaved management! Super like! я┐╜

The salmon belly was absolutely mouthwatering, authentic japanese taste..so was the fresh salmon salad, the dish lives up to its name..the devils breath maki rolls were really good too! All in all, most of the food items are amazing and the overall food experience very good!

Such a overpriced menu! Prices are more than even Sydney :O There are lots of sushi/Bento shops around Sydney City, provides more quantities/varieties in Bento with even lesser price (around $6-$10 = BDT 350-550) Sushi long each $3-$4 (150-240 BDT) Considering cost in Sydney (place and stuff cost in Sydney at least 10 times than BD..) what would be the reason of such high price??

This is very disappointing when you go for unlimited maki offer provided with set menu A, but ended up waiting forever and getting only two maki pieces per person. Either it's a mismanagement or a deception.

Far from a conventional Japanese diner, UMAI is haute to the hilt. Purely the name suggests, the menu offers widest gamut of mouth-watering delicacies, including scrumptious sea foods, zesty meats, splendiferous staples, as well as tantalizing desserts. This chiefly Japanese restaurant is one culinary casting that satiate an appetite, and worthy of repeated encores...

We went to Umai when it originally opened. It was pretty good. Over time, the quality has reduced tremendously. We just had food delivered at home - extremely poor quality and horribly prepared. Not edible by any standards. A complete and utter waste of money.

Very good preparation - really tasty. Will be coming again as soon as possible. As usual though, food price in Bangladesh is fashionably exorbitant. Umai needs to look into the portion of each serving/ dish.
