Hello. My family as well as myself are very frequent customers at Lucknow. Sad to say, today was by far the worst experience I've had. The orders were placed to be taken away. 1. I've ordered a Beef Bhuna; now from my frequent orders, I know what to expect. It is always served cut in to little cubes. Today I got 2 bones and 2 chunks in the item out of which consisted of fat. This was never the case. 2. I've ordered for Chicken Butter Masala. Once I reached home I came to disc...over that it tastes different. I didn't bother checking the receipt before I left because Lucknow has never failed to reach my expectations, but when I did, it was listed Chicken Tikka Masala. 3. The condiments (salad and dressings) were missing. 4. The Naushijan Vegetable Biriani hardly had any vegetables other than potatoes. Also it was extremely spicy.
The food was BEAUTIFUL!!!

Horrible food. Shouldn't have listen to my wife to go there in the first place. We went there at 2:30PM and server told us kitchen will be closed at 3 and we have to order fast with an attitude. Once the food came, presentation was nice but taste was horrible. Definitely won't go there ever again!

Let's talk about the place first. Located at the edge of Sat Masjid Road near the Dhanmondi 27 turning, which provides to be central location for people coming in from Mohammadpur, Lalmatia or Dhanmondi. While they do not have a dedicated parking place they try to make up for it by having numerous guards. Interior is very nice. Well decorated, modern and unlike some very dimly lit restaurants opening up nowadays, this proved to be a welcoming experience offering something qui...te on the contrary. The ambience is very inviting with music in the background and ample room between tables to not overhear the conversations from tables nearby. We were a family of four. After being handed the menu which had decent amount of items we ordered a standard Chinese dinner for my parents whilst me and my sister opted for something from the Indian cuisine. We had ordered more than our table of four could accumulate so were moved to a bigger table. Food was served within approximately 20 mins. The food was good, my parents seemed to enjoy the Chinese cuisine and from little of what I tasted i felt the quality was certainly there. My order of tandoori chicken was good but I felt the butter nan to be pretty dry. The owner as well as the manager came around to ask if the food was okay and I let them know of my dry experience of the nan and they immediately changed it. The second batch of nan was much better. Service proved to be admirable and quite helpful when needed. The staff behavior was excellent. All in all it was a great dining experience. A lot of the food we ordered were leftover so we packed it to take home. They gave us a promotional discount but the final bill without the discount seemed reasonable, we were actually expecting the bill to be more but pleasantly surprised. One of the managers actually walked us to our car while leaving. This feeling of exclusiveness felt great and really made you feel the restaurant is keen on delivering good food and service. Hope they are able to maintain this standard in the future. FINAL VERDICT: Location: 9/10 Interior: 10/10 Food: 10/10 Service: 10/10 Price: 9/10
On of my favourite resturant, loved the food specially guwalati kabab and veg biryani.... Yummy

Food was good. Service was great. Most delicious was grilled vetki and tandoori prawn. Kababs were average. Handi biriyani was ok. All other items were good enough. Those who loves to have ржбрж╛рж▓-ржнрж╛ржд along with spicy beef, mutton or chicken, this is the best restaurant for them ! Chui (ржЪржЗ/ржЪрзБржЗ), the mighty spice that can make you drool anywhere at any moment ! The beef/mutton/chicken pieces where big enough to fill your tummy ! The pulse and the smashed potato are good too. You can choose your own damn meat and very own piece. The service persons are well behaved. Over all a damn cozy place to have lunch or dinner with your beloved ones. Loved it.

I visited few days back. The overall environment and decoration is very pale and sub-standard. The plastic chairs and dirty tables, unhygienic washroom and basin area ruined my taste for having food. Nevertheless, I ordered for their beef and mutton. Simply, taste was rubbish. The mutton was stale and just served after warming the mutton cooked the other day. Anyway, more was left for me. When wished to try their chicken, I was told that it was finished though it was 9 pm only. The brinjal fry was burnt and was not edible at all. The dal was simply as good as that served in a street shop. And finally, the rice was of such poor quality that I can't even imagine even to serve this quality rice to my domestic servant. OK, I tried their firni also and I don't wanna say any more. A total wastage of my money. Determined not to visit ever.

Now the rating is like this because I wasn't able to have food here due to their lack of responsibility. I was planning to go to their Bashundhara branch for sehri and for that I did talk to them a few times to ensure they are open for sehri. Now after going there at 1 AM monday night(Tuesday 1am) I found them closed. When asked they replied they ran out of food that day just after the Iftar and that's why they are closed today. Very unprofessional and hugely disappointing. ... Couldn't you post a note saying that in your FB page!!! What the hell is wrong with you guys!!!

For me it was like tasting the flavour I always liked. But do u realize the price it becomes?? Does it match with the food?? Today I had iftar there.. I m deeply disappointed with everything. I had Fried R...ice with three items.. It was the worst set meal I hv ever had. If i analyse it briefly i will say Food Quality- 2*, Quantity- 1* , Price-1* (300/-) (Excluding VAT). It becomes 345/- total (Without water, Soft drink) .. After hearing a massive exaggeration about this place, went there for lunch. We wanted to try tacos but they said it's unavailable. Then we asked about nachos but they told us that it can be provided with beef only so finally we ordered Grind House Special Pizza 6 inches and club sandwich! And later...we repented for our decision....the pizza was burnt and tasted too bitter we couldn't even finish half! It was that horrible...and the sandwich was average...you can get that a...t any usual fastfood shop so I had to fill my tummy with two coca colas...moreover the place was too hot.. we asked why they aren't running their air conditioners and they said it's because of load shedding...come on you should take the necessary step to run one ac atleast! They were playing music on high volume so they could have the facility of running atleast one ac during power cut anyways I'm giving one star for their service...it was the only thing I liked about the place...had the wish to taste their Jambola Pasta but after having the pizza I wanted to run as soon as possible...sorry but greatly disappointed after hearing such high reviews OVERHYPED ! ... So... That's my girlfriend's review ... Lol... . xD So I spent 720/- for 2 Coca-Cola & a leftover burnt pizza... OH dear., Thank you.. -_- You are doing great .. Grind House.. Will never ever come again.. :/

went there yesterday. First of all, the way of approach was very disappointing. I planned to order student menu, stated on their page. But the waiter said, These are not available now! I asked him to consult it with his manager. He went and came back within a minute and said, they can, but it will take long time. What a strategy to inhibit us to order those set menus as they are relatively cheap in price! After that, I gave feedback to their manager and he said that, there's... The Fried rice was very good with a good smell. The diameter of the glasses were so less that it could held no more than 150-200 ml of soft drink. The last devastating and irritating thing was, they proposed us at least 5 times to give review on Facebook about their food! Why man? Isn't it my choice that I like to give review or not? Do you people have rights to insist? I felt shame that I brought 2 of my friends there. Like others, you people opened up a restaurant to do business and I appreciate that. But, do that with dignity. I hope you will rectify your mistakes. Wish you a good luck.

26/8/2018- Absolute Thai genuine Siamese dishes 5 StarsтнРя╕П The hot and spicy Tom yam soup with seafood was superb and it was beyond description of mere words...! Thai mango salad with crispy cat-fish was not only pleasing to the eyes but it had teased our tastebuds to the fullest as well...!... Stir-fried sliced beef with vegetables was equally good in both looks and taste...! Last but not least, even the steamed rice was fantastic and we whacked it all till the last grain...! A word of thanks to your great staff who had offered their best and impeccable service during our patronage at your outlet. Keep up the good job and we wish to have the chance to come back for more in the near future.

Had dinner with my family. Ordered appetizer platter, 2sopus, seafood salad, jasmine rice and redcurry. The waiter's behaviour was rather defensive and odd.. No customer services whatsoever. Extremely spicy food despite requesting that we have kids. They need to review their chef and staff
Totally disappointed seafood soup.

The worst Thai food ever! I went there five times to prove myself wrong, but the desi chef consistently served us worst possible food every time. First time I went with a friend and we tried a salad, rice noodle with prawn and finally a coconut ice cream. That was by far the acceptable ones, because we could at least finish eating. We have been fed with the lie that a Thai chef is working in the kitchen, whose big picture is proudly displayed at the entrance! From second time... onwards everything went wrong. Called the manager, who says he is looking into it and never returned. We asked the waiters who also disappeared and never came back. It is the third time we found out that their Thai chef has actually gone on leave two months ago, later found out he left four months ago. The current cook is a Bangladeshi who worked in Bangkok for many years. I am sure he never cooked Thai cuisine for Thai people. Probably worked sat ome desi restaurant in Bangkok cooking desi curries and bhartas! He is your so called тАЬThaiтАЭ chef currently preparing all the dishes singlehandedly. My God! Last time we went, we ordered a seafood soup in coconut milk and beef Panama curry. The soup was so sweet that we thought we are having coconut milk sherbet! The beef panang curry was also very sweet. My friend and I were so disappointed that we vouched that we will NEVER COME BACK to Absolute Thai. What an absolute cheating! Be aware!

The worst Thai food i have ever had in my life, We order sea food soup, and pad Thai,, Sea food soup was really bad and dont ask about the pad Thai it was horrifying,, Noodels were overcooked, overloaded with sauce, too much sweet, and very raw egg kinda smell.. They told us their chef is from Thailand,... If a Thai chef couldn't cook pad Thai in a right way then who else does!? Maybe that's he couldn't rise up his career in Thailand я┐╜я┐╜я┐╜я┐╜ and came to Bangladesh я┐╜я┐╜.. The waste of money but our pictures came out really well,, thats the only good thing about this restaurant.я┐╜я┐╜

Items were far less, not everything mentioned in the Iftar+Dinner buffet menu was there. When you are paying 1k++ for buffet and get only 18+ items to choose from you at least expect the taste to be spot on, but the food didn't taste good. They couldn't even get the fried rice rightя┐╜. They claim to be an authentic Thai restaurant but their Pad Thai was the most disappointing dish out of all- It was noodle stirred in a handful of tomato ketchup and eggя┐╜. Also, main and desse...rt items were finished by the time we were done with our appetizer and entree. And the most frustrating part of the dinner was the payment. In their facebook post, they mentioned if you pay through certain bank's card you will enjoy 20% discount. So, I decided to pay with my card, which belonged to one of their mentioned banks, but they gave me only 15% discount. When I let them know about their post, they demanded proof-which I showed them on my phone, but still they were firm and rigid on their claim.

I just had the most amazing experience at Absolute Thai the other day. The Seheri platter is absolutely worth the money. You can have 2 platters only at BDT 850++ and the food is really delicious. Really liked the Chicken Satay and the Prawn Tempura. The Mango sticky rice was a bit weird but really yummy. Way to go Absolute Thai. Going to visit you soon again!

The pad thai was basically boiled flat noodle tossed in sauce and scrambled eggs, no bean sprouts or any greens. The mango with sticky rice was horrible with the rice undercooked maybe because the rice was frozen before it was boiled or whatever. Coconut ice cream was ok but too sweet, the only thing good was the tom yam soup but really getting 1 out of 4 dishes taste right is just disappointing.
Stylish decor and good food. A must go for food lovers

ItтАЩs been awhile since IтАЩve last been here. So, we decided to revisit. And man, how I regret it! The pad thai was so bad and so stinky that we decided to send it back. The only two things that were average was, the fried rice and the red chilli beef. Sea food green curry lacked the flavour and was smelly as well. Fishcake was to rubbery, chicken was basically an overdose of soya sauce. They had only one other table with a family of 5/6 along with us 4, yet my wife literally h...ad to shout тАЬexcuse meтАЭ to call out the waiter, at least 3/4 times. When I asked about if they had discount for credit cards, the waiter said no with a very straight face till I showed him that EBL signature cards are eligible for 15% discount on ala carte. He went to double check and agreed so. The only thing that probably stood out was they didnтАЩt charge us for the pad thai, which we sent back. ItтАЩs really sad to see a restaurant doing so good when they open and only in a matter of time everything deteriorates. Not going back unless they give me free tickets to Thailand!!!
Not that bad. But could have better.
The stuff are great and friendly. I arranged a birthday there they helped me a lot. Their food is tasty as well. Specially the sticky rice.
Above all good Thai food..

Absolutely pathetic! Worst Thai food I ever had. Quality and taste deteriorated to the lowest level

Yes i liked the food. But only thing so far i found totally absurd was the price of the local pepsi can which was 75tk 250ml which must not be more than 40tk highest, i myself buy "imported" pepsi or coke for 80tk, so for imported 330ml cans if you put the price over 100tk still i don't mind... but i am not bound to pay local 30-35tk cans for 75tk at least. It has nothing to do with service charge or any other expense, so no excuse please. One or two waiters need to know the basics before packing the left over foods as well.

Disappointed я┐╜ I absolutely (#punintended) love to find faults when I'm at restaurants so that I can bash them on their facebook page. The DECOR of the place is absolutely simple. Nothing very fancy or bright, it's aristocratic. Everyone is well behaved & very welcoming. The DISHES we ordered were the almost regular Thai dishes which was served rather quick in different unique pots & plates. The aroma was spot on from every dish, as you put the Soup, soaked dim sim or even fried sea bass in your mouth it would just give you the burst of correct flavours. The PRICES seemed reasonable for 1:3 main dishes, 1:1 appetizers and deserts.

Shocking, We tried earlier it was fabulous, this time with friends of early years tried to enjoy but really felt very much disappointed, other than the fish cake and chicken tempura every dish was below par (even it was cold like local Hotel) and finally the so called noodles had to changed after serving,

This is my visit to "Absolute Thai". I am very impressed to have excellent mouth watering dishes. Ambiance is very nice and service is appreciable. On the other side, price are a bit high. Anyway, I wish Absolute Thai a great success in business.

Took my family for dinner and availed the 50% off that I won from their contest. I was worried about the quality since a lot of restaurants do not maintain food quality when they offer discounts. Thankfully their quality was top notch. Very satisfactory experience. я┐╜

Went with a friend for dinner. totally starving after not having had anything to eat the entire day, after shopping. Decided to go for thai food. We arrive around 5ish pm today, there were only 2 tables occupied so of course we expected the service to be fast, but of course that was not the case at all. We ordered thai ice tea, tom yum soup, absolute thai platter, pineapple rice and pad thai. The ice tea too much milk, which ended up really sweet. Tom yum soup was utterly ...disappointing, too much coconut milk. The platter, the only ok, not even good, but ok in it was the fried prawns. The rest was obsolutely rubbish. Pineapple rice was not up to standard at all, the prawn was not fresh at all and the worst of them all which was not even edible and which probably made me and my friend sick was the pad thai, which seemed like it was a left over from yesterday. It had a smell. It was obsolutely rubbish. Worst thai experience i have had. We lost out appetite in the end. We only had a mouthful, paid and left. I felt sick and havent had anything to eat but a chocolate brownie from somewhere else hoping the taste would all be gone and my appetite will get back. But no, my appetite is completely lost. I wouldnt even give this a 1 star! Terrible experience and the service was terrible as well! There were a number of staffs with only 3 tables occupied, including ours however, we had to get up to get the bill as no one came when we called out for anyone! First and last time here. Not worth the time, the food and the money! Dont waste your money! Save the trip! Go somewhere else!
great food & service...

Big disappoinment :( Foods Don't have the wow factor ..just ok While ordered Coconut Ice cream , they served a salty yaak Ice cream and didn't even say sorry while we returned it . Oviously they took the full bill :)

I tasted their Thai soup.. Dim Sim..prawn fried rice..beef chilli.. Thai soup was too delicious.. Dim sim was awosome. Prawn fried rice was look so nice and also so tasty.. Prawn were well cooked inside.. I really like their prawn items.. Every dish was so delicious and tasty.. And real Thailand Recepie.. I just loved it.. я┐╜
best ifter buffet in dhaka..service was very good :)
I'm not a person who gives bad reviews but I suggest they change their name to Absolute Crap. The can of 7up though was amazing.. washed down the crap taste off my mouth.
Platter for two offer is good.
Brilliant experience. Food was delicious. Restaurant was crowded but we were well taken care off. Loved the place simply

Just amazing! Thai food true to its origins. Ideally go with a group so you can taste more of what's on offer, more is always merrier. Stir fried Beef with garlic pepper and the coconut milkshake is personally my favorite,so I'd recommend everyone to try them out.

one of the best thai food in bd.. in this country we rarely find authentic thai food but absolute thai is just absolutely amazing... after long time I found exceptional taste in Soup... omg...coconut ice cream.. sounds weird but this restaurant has totally changed my perception.. the chef is sooo magical...sooooooo happy after having lunch.. looking forward to see more & more unique food..
Filling Thai food at very reasonable price! Shobcheye mojar bepaar holo jara carb avoid Korte Chao, just order the fish or chicken and have it on its own or share it with soup.

Today i had lunch there with some of my friends. The food tasted good as a whole, took Tom yum soup and mixed fried rich with morning glory, chicken hot besil leaf, fish garlic pepper. That was really very nice. Thai lemon mint & lemon grass was simply mouthwatering. Usually for us Bangladeshies, chinese and thai aren't really different. Because we take the cuisine and tailor it in our own way which doesn't leave much of aurhenticity or difference. And we prefer it rather than the original taste as it is spice laced enough to please our tastebud. But, this restaurant lives up to its name and surprisingly the authentic food tastes much much better than our BD style chinese/thai! Overall it was a good experience...
The food is so delicious, I kept saying wow everytime I tasted another bite.
Nice environment....yummy food...liked it so much <3.keep it up

Horrible food. Absolutely tasteless. Probably the worst food I have ever tasted. Took beef with black pepper which was too salty. Then the item Thai Noodle with Prawn was just like eating plastic and was tasteless as well. This fried rice was OK. But the dessert item coconut ice was too much salty. And Mango sticky rice - you never ever going to pay for this awful food. When we called the manager and asked whether you have changed your cook or not? With a gentle smile he answered ''The main cook is going to join from 7th Feb'' I will give you some discount SIR since you did not like the food. Wahhh, what an answer!
Simply Good pricing strategy... I am not saying best but they served good food at reasonable price... nice place for simple hangout.

Horrible service, substandard food, I'm never taking recommendations online ever again. I come in and the waiter asks me "kar kacche ashcchen?" What is that? He spills soup while serving and doesn't apologize. He bumps into the table while bringing the main and again doesn't apologize. When I'm billed, I see something in it I didn't even order. Also, the waiters keep hovering around like vultures the whole time as you eat.

In BD its quite hard to find authentic Thai food as we are mostly recognized with "Bangla thai".Here "Absolute Thai" surely makes difference.The taste of authentic thai food is absolutely mouth watering. Hope to see more diversity in the dessert options.
Food is great! And specially i liked their ambiance. My strongest recommendation is the lemon mint drink. Will be going back again and again for sure.

Food was so good..& the interior & service were cool..

Food was good... we ordered Prawn fried rice, seafood thai soup, beef with pepper and sweet and sour king prawns... apart from the rice (which was ordinary at best), everything else was good... Now the problems... the king prawns isn't really cheap, so one would expect equal sized prawns... but the restaurant does the same trick many other restaurants do, they give 2 actual king prawns and the other 2 is less than half the size.... our total for the food was 2200, which (if i...t was all inclusive) would have been perfect and amazing, and I'd have recommended it to my friends and would have visited again....however, the 15% VAT and 10% service charge took our total bill to closely BDT 3000... upon close calculation, we realised that the 3:1 rice which was 575 BDT would actually cost 718 including the ++ .... paying 718 Tk for 3 person rice feels ridiculous for even a 3 michellin star studded restaurant... similarly, water costs 65++ (BDT 80)... we went on a weekend and it was almost empty.... and I can understand why... despite the restaurant being really nice, not a lot of people would go there more than once... I hope the restaurant management realizes that and does something about it, because I'd love to go there again if the price becomes reasonable...
Food was extremely bad, they even charge a 3 year old baby, please don't go there.
One of the best for Thai cuisine without any doubt, best taste & Wonderful service,Highly recommended to try ifter buffet, I just love it.

It's something special for us. We were 4 people for ifter and buffet dinner .The food was good mainly I liked the most is juice and some different items. Service was good. Mostly I m amused to get a good amount of discount from manager ... it's awesome Thai food in this town . You must try before thinking much.
Welcoming Staffs, good vibes and nice friendly ambience, one of the best ifter & dinner buffet .. awesome food, Great Service, i will definitely suggest my friends to come here.. Really Love it !!!!!

The worst restaurant ever! The manager should learn how to behave with customers especially how to behave with a lady. We gave reservation for 10 people but unfortunately 2 of us couldn't show up. They charged for 10 people and when we went to argue the manager told me " i have never been to any good restaurant so i don't know how it works , all the good fancy restaurants take money for each reservation" and also said many disrespectful things. Never been this offended in my ...entire life. Restaurant is not about food it is also about the customer service. It seems the authority only wants one time customer, and want their customers to get insulted by their mannerless staffs. Its not about money it is about disrespect. Never going there ever , nor will suggest anyone to go. They need to be sued. RUBBISH PLACE TASTELESS FOOD

It should be called absolute rubbish! We had a booking for 14 persons. Unfortunately 4 people could not come. They said we have to pay for 14 people nevertheless. After negotiation, we had to pay for 12 people! Although the restaurant was half empty. The foods were awful and items were very limited and tasteless. Would never recommend to anyone!
The food is good.I loved the service and environment.I will definitely suggest my friends to come here. :-)

Loved the place! One of the best thai food I had recently.. A must try!

The food tasted good as a whole, but I didn't like the mixed fried rice; to be very specific, it lacked seasoning, and had lumps of rice, which were not stir fried properly; the overdoneness came from the oozing mix of dark soya sauce. The Seafood Tom tum and chicken in coconut milk soups were tasty, but I've definitely tasted better flavoured ones in Dhaka. The prawn cakes tasted like store bought frozen ones, they were quite rubbery, the chicken satays tasted good. Chicken... with cashew nut, beef chilli and Fish with black pepper sauce were good, but nothing to be over-hyped about, as Dhaka has seen a vast number of restaurants serving Authentic Thai cuisine. The interior and service both were pleasant. I personally feel they still have space for improvement in their cooking techniques. Overall it was a good experience, my family was happy at the end of the day, and that's the most important thing.

I would not recommend this place to a friend.

Great Ambience! Mouthwatering Food! One of the best place to have your lunch at Dhaka, i must say!

Just had an Absolute Feast with my family at Absolute Thai! Started off the evening with the Mixed Appetizers which was great while we waited (considering that it was a packed Friday night, it did take time, but also gave us the chance to chat). The food was brilliant, and 3 hours later, I am still full and can barely move. The Coconut soup with Seafood was my personal favourite! Supplemented by the Dim Sum, an item that appeared to be a Thai Fuchka and Thai Fishcakes dipped... in a Creamy Garlic Sauce, it was a great opener. We ordered loads of items but the Pad Thai, Red prawn and the Chicken with Green Curry particularly stood out. We ended the evening with the (sweet) Lemon Grass juice and the infamous Sticky Rice with Mango (which really lived upto its hype). The restaurant itself is cozy, comfortable, illimunaited and has a classy feel without trying hard. This place is a must for anyone looking for fine dining with quality Thai food.

Not bad! It is fancy enough and I thought might be pretty expensive. But I would say quantity is good enough against price. Food is decent too. Liked what I ordered except Sticky Mango Rice. Kudos for the quantity they serve on dishes again!
great food and service. The best part is you can finish your dinner and follow it up with some delicious dessert from tastebud, which is just downstairs

"Absolutely fantastic " !!! Tastes just Like Thailand...best ifter cum dinner buffet ...must try, Service was Excellent !!! Recommended for authentic thai food Lovers!!!

Absolute Crap. Almost walked out after having an excuse of a fish cake, 'mama piaju' would've fared better. Somehow restrained myself to give the rest of the foods a chance. But alas, none of the foods looked appetising to start with; the rice & noodle were too sweet & the curries were salty. I didn't quite get from which angle this was Thai cuisine apart from some Thai spices & vegetation randomly thrown in. And apparently the chef is Thai. Well, I can imagine he was probably found selling Thai mama piaju on the streets of Thailand. Worst Thai food experience.

This restaurant has worst customer service. They made me wait for forty five minutes. We ordered tortellini ragu which is the worst pasta I have ever tasted. Even the steak and pizza was not up to mark.

Suggesting the authority to keep some options of online payment system like Dmoney, Ipay, Upaye etc for hassle-free and secured online payment system of bill payment.... We the employees of Dmoney and Square Group wish to pay the bill with Dmoney Account instantly. Cash transaction is too much main stream & hazard full to us. Food and Environment is so good ! Good place to stay with partner !

Entered Spaghetti Jazz at roughly 2.45pm after calling them up to find out if they were open and where exactly the restaurant was. They asked us to order fast as they we gonna stop the kitchen operations at 3pm. We ordered 2 mushroom steaks. They were quick to serve the food. The grilled vegetables were good. Mashed potato was a little dry. Steak was dry and chewy. Mushrooms tasted bland. The waitress kept on hovering around us and handed the bill over to us not even halfway through the meal. She insisted we pay up the bill then mentioning that they were going to go on a break. At no point were the waiters/wiatresses cordial with us. Their attitude was outright impolite. We should have been notified on arrival that they were going to have a soft-close at 3 and wouldn't be able to serve us then. We would have been alright with that and left. Instead, they served us overcooked steaks and provided us the worst service I've experienced since 2013. To the Management: I am sorry but your steak was overpriced considering the quality and you really need to hire new staff. Alternatively you can also remove the service charge from your prices and make your employees work for the tip, who now get it regardless of how they treat your customers. The two stars I have given you is because of the grilled vegetables and the positive attitude of the guard with the beard; the only good things about our experience at SJ today. This is a very constructive criticism, please take note of it.
Steak served on sizzling hot iron plate. Great value and superb taste. Highly recommended.

Probably the best buffet restaurant for dinner in Dhanmondi in terms of food quality and variety, price and ambience with a few small shortcomings that you'd do well to be prepared for. The buffet begins at your table with "starters" i.e. the day's bbq served at your table - chicken, fish and mutton with naan, which is refilled as you finish the serving. Although the waiters claim that the starters are "un-limited", after you've asked for a refill twice, service slows down an...d the waiters begin to discourage you from asking for more refills by repeatedly telling you that the bbq is only a starter and that you can now try the main buffet. It might get annoying, but as I found out, it's not bad advice since the buffet is quite good. The main dishes aren't the same old buffet dinner fare you see over and over again, but different and tasty. Their chicken biryani, creamy chicken and lemon fish in particular were really good. The chicken soup and chicken basil leaf were a little too salty though. The others - onion prawn, shahi paneer, beef etc were good. Among their deserts, their shahi tukra and brownie were good while the others - bread pudding, firni, fruit etc were just plain. However, they also serve kulfi! It wasn't out of the world, but hey - it's kulfi! Overall, definitely a place I'd recommend for dinner. And if you take my advice - don't try to get all your money's worth from the bbq alone; save it for the buffet, it's worth it. P.S. the menu changes from day to day, and so might your experience there.

Good variety of starters and main courses, but limited variety of desserts. Probably the best dining option in that area, which is quite important given the traffic in Dhaka. Only the buffet option is available, which is not convenient if you want to order something specific for a smaller amount, but overall the value for money is quite adequate. Drinks are not included in the buffet price.

Cold skewered meat, bland food, worst mixed vegetables I've ever had (literally felt like I was chewing on wood chips soaked in gravy), dry pasta, something that they called fish (not sure what kind of fish was that, as a seafood lover and as someone who traveled to distant places for good fish, I felt offended by the fish dish). I'm not sure why people gave it such high ratings. Spent time with a lot of loved ones, that was the highlight of the visit, certainly not the food. Never going there again even if someone paid me to go there.

It was nice, felt like an overseas buffet restaurant. The built-in BBQ grill table with unlimited kebabs is their main attraction. For starters, they served chicken boti, mutton shish, fish, Indian paneer & potato kebabs. I loved the chicken kebab most, it was well marinated with yogurt and spices. Other than that, they had chicken corn soup, papadums, chutneys & lots of salads. The main course had a rather small but good selection of dishes. The Hyderabadi biryani was nice b...ut the meat wasn't tender enough and it was made from "mixed cuts". I also liked the beef chili (bhuna), fish with lemon grass, prawn with tomato & basil and shahi paneer (similar to korma). There were only four dessert items with unlimited kulfi. The buffet price (Tk.1200) doesn't include VAT or any drinks. Overall, it would be better if they could include mutton boti kebab for starters and expand the menu for main course & dessert items.
Arrangements were good but service could be better... as we went for a buffet dinner, I found less items as desert.... There could be more main dishes... Truly speaking, I was not impressed....

From the outside it doesn't look much but its a different story once you step inside. Quite well decorated with comfortable sitting arrangements. Went there first time during for Iftar + dinner. The highlights of the menu were the whole lamb, whole fish, lasagna and teriyaki chicken. The lamb was well marinated and soft, while the fish was also equally marinated. The lasagna was exceptionally good specially for a buffet Iftar menu. One other thing which I liked was the live grilling station serving minute steaks, prawns and grilled mackerels. The staff were quite attentive, quickly clearing out our plates during the buffet and checked with us if food was ok or if we need anything else. Hope they can keep up the level of quality and service
This meal was very tasty. I want to go again and again.

LetтАЩs talk about service: in one word awesome, the quality of food was really good and mouthwatering. The environment was really nice. I liked the BBQ part itтАЩs really well cooked and juicy. Must visit this place for their quality food, hospitality and environment. Shaw's Steakhouse has already won acknowledgements and certifications for itтАЩs quality food, service & environment. Wish them all the very best in future.

First thing that i look when i reach an eatery is a parking spot, even though Shaw is located near a very busy exit but their outdoor personnel efficiently managed and secured me a good parking spot. The decor and the ambience is very luxurious but entering the place made me feel awkward as i found the restaurant staffs (waiters) themselves sitting at guest chairs and watching TV. They couches are very cozy to sit but i also think they congested the place with too much sittin...g arrangement. They should have left more free space for free movement even though they have such a big floor. Their food quality is excellent, the steaks were perfectly marinated and cooked to perfect flavors and temperature, the taste and the look shows that dishes are cooked delicately here. However the portion is the issue!! I think the servings are not adequate, even the pictures taken of the food on the plate looks poor. I think the main courses served should have the standard portion Quantity that any other fine dining offers. The Manager was a very nice gentlemen. And the waiter who served us was also very attentive and gentle. Also charging 15Tk only for the bottled water was cool !!
I was always bit confused when someone asked me, which is the best steak place in city. now i can proudly say.. shaws steak is the best place to have steak. best ambience, best food, best service.

Pretty much the worst steak house I have ever been to..... Steak tasted salty and the chef probably do not have any idea how to prime a steak.... Used spices on a steak... Yuck.... Felt like I had fried masala beef fry....

If I go for honest reviews I am a die hard steak fan.. for which I keep on experimenting trying steaks at different places, wont go into direct comparison but I can assure you their steaks and dessert are the best out there. Point to be added this is the perfect place for well off dinner. Need a second visit out there :) Ambiance:9/10 Quality:8.5/10 Service:10/10 Price: good things cost you a bit
Amazing ambience with quality service and great taste of steak and seafood. Must try тЬМ

Went there with high expectation. The appetiser was okay but the main dishes were pathetic. There was some smell coming out from the steak and didnтАЩt like the flavour at all. Also we complained about it to the manager and he gave us complementary desserts which also tasted smelly. The presentation was good, service was good but sadly the food taste was not up to the mark. It is an expensive food place so it is normal for customer like us to expect that high quality and value for money we are paying. Hope they will improve and give us the chance to say something good in the future!
this one is really worth recommending for steaks in dhaka city.
Each and every food item was extraordinary.... really awesome, keep it up guys. Thanks a lot for your warm hospitality and fast service.

ShawтАЩs Steakhouse in Dhaka is located in Gulshan 2, however is a major let down. First I wanted to go there for a dinner on the day before EID, since they had a promotion (discount plus free drink). I contacted the restaurant and confirmed that they are open. Unfortunately I went there then accordingly only to discover that the restaurant had closed already at 7.00 p.m. without prior notice. Nevertheless I agreed to give it a second try and went there once more today, only to... be even more disappointed. What I noticed immediately was that the restaurant was extremly empty, that though might have been to the early time of the day (7.45 p.m.). I would have loved to eat several of their items on the menu, but to my disappointment the majority of their items were unavailable. The issue started small, first one starter wasnтАЩt available and we asked for some more time to re-think alternatives. Shockingly the issue of them being out of items continued, for the next 7 (starters, salds, steaks, pasta dishes,тАж !!) items we wanted to order each time as an alternative. They each time said that the item would be unavailable or that they had run out of stock (for example Beef nachos was apparently already sold out). . but at 7.45 p.m. and only two other customers at the restaurant that seemed to be highly unlikely.. ironically enough they later tried to suggest that we take one of their more expensive platters which contained 4 of the items that they had told us before would be unavailable and rest only the most expensive items were available from the menu. It is evident to me that the restaurant which had a decent amount of potential is just being run-down and not properly managed and that must be the reason why there are no or hardly any customersтАж (despite their social media presence being very professional).
One of the best place for steaks and seafood in Dhaka. It's a must try for any steak or seafood lover.

In the beginning home service was A class. No delivery charge as my home is near by and amount of food was adequate so was the quality. I have been ordering for quite some time now. Hats off Take A Bite. 1 Chicken Burger, a decent amount of French fry and a bottle of coke. Only 120 bdt. I would not say this is the best burger I ever had but it was good. When I order, I thought burger would be a small one, but I was wrong. This much food on that price range is really commendable. Just one little advice if you want to take. Please try to serve all the food at a time. Otherwise, we customers get confused. "Where is my French fry? Where is my coke?" :p Anyway, best of luck guys. Will be there again.

Hands down, worst pasta I've ever eaten. I'd go one step further and say It's probably the worst fast food I've eaten ever. Pizzas found in Cha Birir tong with a price tag of 25 taka taste much better than this. I ordered a naga baked pasta. It had 70% rubber, 29.99% oil and 0.01% chicken. Not even a single molecule of cheese. Literally there was nothing that can resemble anything close to cheese. There were in total 3 microscopic pieces of chicken. Taste: 0/10... Price: -inf / 10 ( I was charged 239 taka for this piece of crap. ) I get that it can be hectic before iftar and quality of some items might fall. But what I was delivered, was simply garbage. Unless someone's dying of hunger, s/he dare not touch this abomination.

I went there today for the first time with my friend to try their pasta. Even before we got the food I got so mad and frustrated by the attitude of one of the waiters. I'm pretty sure the owner doesn't know about this mismanagement, I hope he does and take some necessary actions against their service and the behaviors of the waiters.

Went there for the first and last time. Environment 0/10. Old tables and polishes were coming off. AC was turned off. The pasta was the worse pasta I've ever eaten and it didn't have no spice and it was nowhere near to be called naga pasta . Took it as parcel as it was tasteless. After going home it was a rotten as they surely served bashi pasta. Giving 3 star rating because chow mein was a bit up to the mark. Horrible experience. Will never ever go there again.

Went to Pasta State Dhanmondi to have unlimited Pasta.... I had buffet and Unlimited meals at least 30-40 times in the last few years but this wast the worst unlimited offer.... Here's a short review~ So when I was entering the restaurant a guy was going out , he came back 1 minute after that and complained that a cockroach came out from his Pizza Box я┐╜ I saw the cockroach too.... Kinda lost my appetite there... They probably changed his pizza after that. After that we were w...aiting and the electricity went off, The whole restaurant was for at least 15 minutes so I am guessing they don't have a generator. Finally they served the pastas 20 minutes before Iftar... it was looking good to be honest... So after azan we started eating and the next experience is horrible... There was only cheese top layer... they just mixed mayonnaise with some boiled pasta and topped it with a lil bit of cheese and served it... At least 1/5th part of the bowl was full of oil я┐╜ I ate 20 huges slices of pizza in another restaurant last week so eating 5/6 bowls or atleast 3 bowls of Pasta is nothing for me... My friend didn't even try another bowl... I went for a second one and they said they don't have any more bowls to serve the pastas so they started serving in take away containers.... Btw ALL of the plates and bowls were broken (the edges) I couldn't even finish the second one... so I requested a waiter to pack it up for me so I can give it to someone on the street since it's Ramadan we shouldn't waste food я┐╜ They packed it up.... Almost everyone took their pasta in parcel because they couldn't finish it... (though it was an unlimited offer) They are serving their "Special Baked Pasta" only with Coke/Sprite~ Price : 345tk (including everything) Taste : 2/10 я┐╜ Environment : 5/10 Service : 5/10 I won't even recommend my enemy to go and take this order я┐╜ Really disappointed~

My student was asking me for the past year to meet up with him near his old house. I just couldn't make any time, until today. :( :) I looked up the food places near Taj Mohol road, Dhaka on Google maps, and it was the same old same old, BFC/KFC/Pizza Hut BS. I didn't want to go to any of them. I wanted to try some place new. As I kept searching a little marker stood in one far north-west corner of the map. It read Bell Pattio. I called my student and we met up nearby, only t...o be greeted by an exhausted employee in a small lone, gloomy room of a restaurant. I wondered all the time whether they actually served anything at all. The exhausted employee asked us if we wanted the works, to which we simply replied "sure". The Pizza arrived in 10min. It was the fastest pizza order I ever received in town. And it was superb! I recommend all to come here at least once if not more, in their lifetime. 5/5

They sell sausage pizza in all their varieties... Filmy cafe sell their Pizzas by changing the name and price. I used to buy a lot from them, see my previous comments at this page... But by time, they have resorted to cheating... There are Real Pizza restaurants around... Stay away or regret!!!

My friend and I wanted to try this place after seeing a review on Instagram. It was a little difficult to find since neither of us had been to Shakhertak. We ordered a Meat Lovers Supreme. The pizza arrived in 15-18 mins, piping hot. It was the kind of pizza one would find at a restaurant like Pizza Hut, which was a pleasant surprise. It does say "Beef and Chicken" in the pizza description but they came in sausage form and not their usual form. This was a bit unusual but not a bad idea. The dough was fresh, there was a good amount of cheese, the service was good, and the price was very very reasonable. I hope they continue doing what they're doing because it's working. I hope to visit them once again soon.

Chicken Steak with Rice (This offer is not available now) Price : 239 + vat Although this offer is not available now I am posting this if it again pops up. The food was indeed what was shown on the promo photo by Bunkers Khilgaon. Mostly the place was humble enough to let us celebrate our friend's birthday. The hospitality we got was indeed astonishing. So if you guys are finding it hard to get a decent place to have some quality time with your friends and family. I would re...ally recommend you Bunkers я┐╜. Pasta Basta Price : 350 + vat It was another meal I had there. One of the best pasta basta in khilgaon I ever had. The two layer pasta was full of chicken and beef. If you are a pasta fan I would really ssuggest you to go there and try this. Lastly we went up there without any previous reservation, so if you guys are planning on going there please do call them or inbox them before you go there.
Definitely a place to hangout with your friends and family. Good quality food with affordable price range on the menu. Supported by great service by the staff.

Worst service.. They had only three tables to cover.. They somehow managed that to look like a rush.. Took more than one hour to serve simple oven baked pasta which by the way was blunt and creamy. The chicken steak oregano tasted good but the quantity and the price don't match at all. Set menu was average with very unpleasant decoration.. But coming back to my first point, if you guys can't serve anything within a given time please do have the decency to accept it and tell us on the face. People who came late and ordered late got their foods served but others had to wait for no apparent reason ! Customers don't want 10% honour or whatsoever for your lousy service.. Never going back to your place and obviously not recommending it to others.. but then again with so many customers in your grasp a lousy review doesn't matter anyway.

good people,good food n also very much professional in their attitude. They actually behave as the 5тШЕ hotels n motels staffs r behaving. very good place and also good food n one special fact is their food r all fresh,which is such a good quality.

If you wanna have some quality time with your family , friends or beloved one , then this place is the perfect one!! The quality as well as the taste of the food is also perfect and delicious <3 So friendly and comfortable zone it is я┐╜ Thanks to the #Bunkers team for making my special day , more special with your support <3 !!! Keep it up!!

During last Saturday, I had Iftar cum dinner buffet at Bunkers. So guys, I am reviewing on the basis of only this; do not relate this with any of their regular platters. I had only tasted what was offered in that buffet menu. THE WORST BUFFET EVER I EXPERIENCED !!!... I am not writing this on anger. I let myself cool down, waited for than two days and were thinking where that went wrong; now reviewing. 1. If a restaurant offers buffet, it should be only buffet. No other regular platter should be offered during that time span. That creates a mess. They were offering buffet with every other regular platters. Hence, there place wasn't well designed and stuffs were not properly trained to handle such mayhem. 2. They offered around 30 items and to refill one dish we had to wait like 10 to 15 minutes; standing in a line. If you don't have enough structural setup and expertise to handle a house full of guests, why you guys offer buffet? 3. There were shortage of food. Usually people have spring roll with soup. They were refilling soup but spring roll was vanished; literally vanish after first round. When I asked, they replied (рж╢рзЗрж╖ рж╣рзЯрзЗ ржЧрзЗрж╕рзЗ ржнрж╛ржЗрзЯрж╛, рж╕рж░рж┐). What nonsense is that? Do you guys even know what buffet means? 4. And there was an item of chicken covered with sauce (I forgot the name). That was good. I could grab 3 pieces and yet again, never refilled. According to their menu, they should have an item of beef, haven't seen it. A guest from the next table said that they gave a new dish, spicy chicken; I went and an empty plate was there. I complained and probably the store manager said (рж╕рзНржпрж╛рж░, ржжрж┐рзЯрзЗ рждрзЛ ржХрзБрж▓рж╛рждрзЗ ржкрж╛рж░ржЫрж┐ ржирж╛, ржжрзЗрзЯрж╛рж░ рж╕рж╛ржерзЗ рж╕рж╛ржерзЗржЗ рж╢рзЗрж╖ рж╣рзЯрзЗ ржпрж╛ржЪрзНржЫрзЗ). Dear that person, let me apologize for my language, but are you stupid? Do the math. Count the number of ovens you have, number of cooks in there, stuffs you have, estimate your food preparation pace, understand how many guests you can handle and over buffet for 5 less than that number. Pizza wasn't included in the buffet menu they showed me but they were offering it. WORLD'S THINNEST PIZZA, I MUST SAY! :P Everyone must go and have a look; really astonishing. 6. Last Friday we planned to dine out and headed to Pizza Hut at Dampara, Chittagong. We ordered for a large size cheesy bite pizza with chicken & other expected toppings, baked chicken pasta, fried button mushroom and cream of chicken soup. We were really shocked to find just a few tiny chunks of chicken as part of the toppings over the so-called pizza. Cream of chicken soup was also nothing special. By pouring little cream on a typical glutinous soup, you can't name it cream o...f chicken soup for your very kind information. Trust me, I had much better baked pasta at Da Signature in Chittagong and Shawarma House in Dhaka. Your baked pasta was awefully gravy when the cheese layer was taken off the top. Are you guys making money in Bangladesh by fooling innocent hard-working people down here? Are you ripping us off by using the brand "Pizza Hut"?

Ordered two medium pizzas with extra cheese on both of them. Got one perfectly cut pizza with cheese on top of it and other one with no extra cheese and cut unevenly. Moreover, both of them were cold. Why is your delivery service so poor?

I order almost 2-3 times a week from Pizza Hut PHD Dhanmondi. I order pizza all the time but unfortunately I ordered the chicken mushroom pasta today which happens to be the worst pasta I ever had. No trace of white sauce, the use of slightly roasted onions was so much that it made me wonder if the main ingredient was pasta or onion. You guys just packed me a box full of garbage! Picture in the comment section!
One of the worst pizza i ever had in my life.Better you serve better food by increasing your price or better walk out from your business.Food is not always about price.Quality is important.

Pizza hut is a international chain restaurant. But in Bangladesh I donтАЩt think itтАЩs official anymore, because the service, food and environment wasnтАЩt like that what it is used to be 5 years back. Me and my wife went last monday the waiter who took our order was stupid. Soup was cold and they are literally cleaning the sealing even people are eating. Well bla bla bla bla. Transcom company should shut it off.
i love their pizza their pizza is so tasty

we are dedicated pizza hut customers for long,we normally order online.During Eid holidays my husband ordered a pizza, which was not upto the mark. He just took the online survey and mentioned about it. after that, the awesome customer service is just chasing us for giving us the complementary pizza!!!today they had sent a pizza and the delivery person was apologising in a row for our previous experience. This was a whole new customer service experience for us.Keep it up Pizza Hut!
Spend a great time there. Food was good. Staffs were friendly and active. The restaurant was clean as usual. Serving time could be improved.

Seeking attention to the higher authority! Just been to baily road branch and the food was aweful. Specifically the topping and cheese were smelly on top of that waiter took my order wrong and over charged me so I complained and they kept me waiting while getting the numbers right. I left a complain feedback but I doubt whether it will reach to the higher authority ever. Disgraceful overall!

One of my favorite place to eat & hangout.. most of the staff are friendly, environment is always neat & clean & got great vibe! ThereтАЩs PizzaтАЩs smell really attractive & tests is delicious !!! Love it

Good God! After enjoying meals in Pizza hut across the world all my life, I took my boy out during the school break for a treat. He ordered the "special" pizza... which turned out to be nothing remotely like what we're used to. Listen, seriously, I know this is Bangladesh and all and you're trying to cater to the native palate but **you don't have to**... pizza hut is now off our list of places (for me and my wife and my son - hat-trick - perfect) because of this monstrosity they served us. If I wanted a Bengali pizza from an American chain (on home ground), I'd head down to my local Habib Hotel and order their curry and rice. It was hideous. The product development team need to stick up a reminder on their desks, "If it ain't broke, don't fix it!" Meanwhile, I shall be taking my wallet somewhere where I get a pizza when I order one.
best pizza in bashundhara

I ordered pizza by Food panda. the worst ever i eat. this is iftre time guys. my family didn't told me anything. they send me two pizza. it was buy 1 get 1 free offer. but there is no cheese (what we expected). bread was too much dry. after the iftar, in night i baked extra slice in oven and what??? it looks same as a "pauruti" with some onion :( ...sorry pizza hut. please do something good, because you have good reputation in pizza. :( sorry for poor rating.
the quality is very good and the pizza is very tastyЁЯШЗ yeah i would surely recommend pizza hutЁЯШК

To the authority, I have been a dedicated customer of Pizza Hut for more than 5 years. Your pizzas and service has always intrigued me. However, recently I have seen you charge high "exclusive" VAT and Tax rates for the products. For example, you are charging VAT and Tax for buying soft drinks from your outlets at high rates (BDT132/- VAT+Appl SD for Cheese Lovers and one Mirinda worth BDT 548/- total). Another case: BDT 104/- VAT+Appl SD for a meal worth BDT 699/- I want to know the reason behind this increase. Regards, A Dedicated Customer of Pizza Hut who is loosing faith in the services of the brand.

I used to be very regular at Pizza hut. Recently I had been to pizza hut, gulshan outlet. The service and food quality had been degraded so much I had no idea. I used to keep on calling for attendees, keep asking for services but it took a lot of time to seek their attention. For payment they took my card and no one returned it back. I had to rush to other waiters to find out my cards. Then managers had to come to sort out problems. I had never faced such service. Very heartbroken with the carelessness. Also the taste of food changed drastically. I really don't know is there any reason left I will ever visit there. very much disappointing.

Alhumdulillah! Had a wonderful time at pizza hut gulshan 1 today. We arranged an iftar party for 60 orphans there in a reasonable price n the staff n service were genuinely warm n helpful. Mr shamim, the manager with koushik n rajib, the staff made the experience-memorable for the children. May Allah bless them
Great services. this is a best place for breakfast and enjoy parti there have a more manus.
Please make sure that all yours outlets have the actual real offers. And updated all the offers at the web. And do not make people Harris and at list try to keep your company reputation well. Thanks
Best Pizza chain in town .

Today I tried the chicken arrabbiata pasta from your Bashundhara outlet. The pasta was absolutely disgusting! I know it is not right to criticize food this way but the food you served tasted so bad. Such a waste of money. There was no cheese and the pasta was undercooked. No wonder this particular outlet is always empty.
nice atmosphere good food

I want to thank pizza hut chittagong CDA Ave (near bus stop) for extraordinary service. We were travelling from CTG to Dhaka. We ordered a pizza and said that our bus will leave in 5 mins, can u make it? They said they ll deliver if they cant. So time ran out and our bus was leaving, so we hurriedly went for the bus and asked them to cancel the order. Our bus started and we were upset that pizza hut couldnтАЩt provide our food. Suddenly the bus stopped and a pizza hut delivery guy came in with our pizza. We were shocked! He chased the bus to deliver our pizza. This shows amazing customer service from them. Thank u again and special thanks to the delivery guy.
Presentation is a factor, Sometimes in rash situation we do lacks in our presentation. But I prefer Pizza Hut for it's itself image.

With no doubt I love your pizza a lot.. bt I dont Understand why pizza hut charging 132++ to buy a soft drinks. its too high man. In other Countries its so cheap then why Bd pizzahut is so Expensive. Simply marvellous their efforts to satisfy their customers. On 9th April I ordered a triple chicken stuffed crust pizza and got dissapointed. The cheesy bite was dry. Ektuo moja na. No capsicum or chicken was present. Cheese er balai o chilo na. Pura dhoka. I ordered red and hot cheesy bites. Homedelivery niye chilm. On store hole khub boka pawna chilo. Ja Mon chay ekta banay 1634tk nichche. Ami radhtei pari na shei amr hater pizza o er theke hajar moja. Nam diyeche cheesy bites but in reality it should be garlic bun bites with ekdm moja na toppings. I'm soooo disappointed. I was really hoping something good, seeing their advertisement. They just created an illusion for cheese but the food quality is very poor. ekdm betrayal! Parcel er sathe sauce o dey nai. I felt charity khabar dise etto joghonno. My location chittagong city.

The meatball pasta was awful. Zero spices. No sauce. The pizza was marginally better but cold. Never ordering again. They took more than an hour to prepare the food. If you can't handle a lot of orders at a time you should not give such offers. Waste of money.

I ordered an Italian Deep Dish pizza tonight through HungryNaki. It was supposed to be 12" but it seemed smaller, but I didnt whip out a scale to measure. There was no Beef ham, Bacon, Pepperoni, Onion or Capsicum. The depth of the bread was not filled, essentially making it a non deep dish pizza. The marinara was salty and the cheese was stringy. It might be the worst pizza I have ever had. Funny thing is the quality wasnt this bad before, they had a pretty amazing deep dish pizza. But what I got tonight, I wouldnt even feed my dog. Pathetic.
I ordered an American pie pizza. Taste was horrible also it was so tiny and they took 900+vat for this horrible pizza For me it wasn't worth it

I didnt like the ambience and their ac didnt work at all it was all warmed up and the damn waiter said it was in 16 degree !!! He didnt have the decency to offer me any 3rd slice !! He served all of them in the same table not me! I didnt bother to ask him ! He was an idiot ! The money is not worth it at all I will not recommend anyone to visit you guys again.

i went today around 18:30. most probably a party going on.. We waited a long and asked their staffs.but no one paid a little attention. then i went to counter and asked if food can be served? they said they can and then they took the order.. we 3 gave order of meat ball combo.. after a long wait we got that combo..first they served the pasta..it was so tasteless that we can take only one spoon.. then comes the pizza.. after taking one bites,it seems to me me that the price of salt & spices are so high that they cant afford for the offer... seems like eating a diabetics bread.. and that not at all meat ball..it can be kind of sausage.. as a result,pizza also kept the same after taking one bite.. for the first time i faced such a tasteless pizza & pasta that we have to kept the whole for them.

Tried their poutine and impasto hot pasta, the poutine was quite delicious, and the heat of peppers in pasta was something exquisite, it hits you when you least expect it, its not something too overpowering but a subtle taste that goes well with all the ingredients, but the pasta was a bit runny, should have kept it under the broiler a tad bit longer. Had their fried rice too which they have placed as appetizer and it actually is properly put as the rice would not make you full but make you salivate and hanker for more. Overall had a very good experience.
Best pizza in town. Pasta was delicious as well.

I was there with friends and each time my friends wanted to order something, the waiter countered asking them to order someone else. For example, a friend ordered Thai chicken, and the waiter said to order grilled chicken. Another friend ordered chicken pizza and the waiter said to order seafood pizza. These are just 2 examples. The entire fiasco went for more than 15 minutes. And the waiter wasn't even suggesting alternatives. He was blatantly saying, no try the other one. I was extremely pissed with the service and never going back there again.
Food is average and overpriced, but it is a good place to sit and spend some time without the staff harassing you to leave. I usually go there for a solitary time, coffee and a book.

I have had quite a few dishes here. I think one was stuffed potatoes with pasta. The potatoes were delicious but the pasta was too sweet. I've also had the chicken Ala Keiv. For about 700tk we got 4 tiny pieces of stuff chicken. Totally not worth it. The ravioli, seafood soup, grilled chicken & lemon mint soda were really good though. There are very few good restaurants in jfp & if they actually listen to all the input it could really be one the best. But for now it's definitely worth a try

Had ordered a chicken chowmein...almost choked to death as the meat in the chowmein had bones and one got stuck in my throat...kept coughing forcefully and drank a lot of water which helped the bone slide down...isn't chicken chowmein supposed to be prepared with boneless meat only??

Today I orders the "sea food platter" , which was extremely salty. one of the worst sea food I have ever taken. Service and environment is good though. Been there two times, but never liked their food.

Shittiest place I've ever been. I ordered crab soup. That tasted like "jhol" and had crab shell0s in it. My boyfriend ordered pasta that was undercooked. The service was really bad. The waiters were rude. Apparently the platters are limited, so we could only order platter 1. They served with missing ingredients. After calling them a million times, they came and added the missing ingredients. Also, the platter says 3 dates but they provided only 1. Not that it matters, but at least don't mention the quantity if you can't deliver. The vegetable and the Dory fish batter had hair. We were so pissed off and there was no time to change, so we just didn't bother to let them know or anything. The food was mediocre. Nothing exceptional. The service and the hair made the experience worse. Highly disappointed. We are paying for good service and good food. The least they can do is not serve unhygienic food and be nice to us.

We went at around 1 pm, and a little later the waiter told us the food would be around 20 minutes late. This was supposed to be brunch, so we asked them to serve us some food which would come fast, while we waited for the rest. They told us the prawn dim sum would be served in 5 minutes, but it came 20 minutes later. After an hour and half, around 2:30pm, we still hadn't been served anything else! We told the manager that we'll only take any food which they could serve by 2:30, but they failed to serve us our orders even by then. We paid for the dim sums and left ravenously hungry, with no apologies from the manager. Apparently there was some owner's brunch which caused this unacceptable delay! Worst service ever.
Great food, excellet customer service and

I love Chow's dumplings but the price I pay for includes food n service both. We went for a friend's birthday last month n ordered the lamb from the main course (as I had it before n I liked it). I put a piece in my mouth and found the lamb totally cold. My friend thought that the dish has to be served cold but as I mentioned that I had it before. So, I called the waiter n told him about it. He took away the dish right then and came back with explanation - "the chef went out ...of the kitchen so the other person in charge prepared the dish and he forgot that he didn't warm it." We are paying this price to have refrigerated food??? The manager came to say sorry n served us complementary brownie but how can it replace the fact that they serve cold food from the refrigerator. I have never seen the management write a reply to any of the reviewer so I wonder, does it really make any difference to them?

horrible....price wasn't justified with the quantity of food..so was the taste я┐╜...and really dissappointed.

Let's get one thing clear. A restaurant like Chows has two things to offer. Cuisine and service. Food is great. Proportions are not. Service not good at all. They'll take orders only to return about it's unavailability or the excuse of how difficult it would be to serve hot n sour soup as they're backedup at the kitchen. One garcon even took my dinner plate along with cutleries thinking that i'm done eating. I thought he's giving me a fresh plate after i tried their delicious flash fried whole fish. But I was mistaken :) Great chef. Poor service.

I was impressed by the decor but was disappointed soon by the food. Food is overpriced and bland. The quantity of each item was very small compared to its high price.I had better dumplings in Dhaka. The chowmein was chewy, leathery and cold. I didn't find any Cantonese flavour in any dish. Even the iced tea was very bitter. The service was very slow and poor. I didn't expect such poor service and bad food from a high-end restaurant like Chows.

A complete disappointment, most of the food we ordered was left uneaten as it tasted stale and unappetizing , the prawns we ordered tasted mushy and had a funky flavor, as did their whole fried fish and fried rice, not at all what you'd expect from a premium establishment. Do not recommend and definitely won't be coming back.

Ambiance is perfect for any hangout. Interior is beautiful & serene. Food is also awesome.. The prawn har gow, chicken sui mai, chicken chilly with black bean sauce.. Though the beef item that we ordered could not stand up to our expectations. But overall it was a nice place to spend time with near & dear ones with delicious food added.

Was extremely disappointed with the service yesterday. We went there for brunch and waited for nearly 1.5 hours and yet the food was not served. Whenever we inquired about the order, they kept insisting that the food would be out in 10-15 minutes. Eventually we got up and left. The staff needs to be given a training on customer service (try getting a crash course from the staff at Izumi)!
Salt is a major concern. All the dishes that we had it was salty. Decor and service we're excellent. We reserved the private room.

Well the food was good as usual. But a bit disappointed on the buffet offering during iftar. I thought the menu would be eat as much as you can but i was surprised with the appetiser being served once as set menu and buffet dinner on the five mains. Come on chows your edm for the offer was misleading

I made a reservation for four at 2:30 pm yesterday. I was there on time, however, my friends had reached a few minutes prior to 3:00 pm. Before they could make themselves comfortable, a waiter insisted that we order at once, since apparently their kitchen closes at 3:00 pm. We did, and waited for 40 minutes (which they asked from us) for our food. Immediately after we finished, our waiter had gotten us the bill before we even asked, and said that they were to have a staff pa...rty- an implication that we leave. The food was good, but not out of the world. Therefore, from such a high-end restaurant, service at-least is well desired from a customer's end. Provided the place would be overcrowded (or even close to being crowded) on the occasion of Pohela Boishakh, I would have understood. I'm afraid that many other reviews well portray how they tend to serve their customers.

By far The best Chinese in town. Food is excellent and so is the ambience & service. No wonder why the elites and diplomats living around patronise it so highly both at lunch and dinner. We availed the buffet iftar,dinner. But the iftar was set menu and dinner had only 5 items including rice & chowmein moreover the taste was average. I don't know about their regular menu but the buffet was not good.

After all the reviews about their service being not up to mark, i was a bit skeptical. But i was really surprised to find their service top of the line. They were very humble and veryyy nice. every person who came to our table and served us food had a big smile and they really do make u feel good about ordering and eating there. The food was just next level. My friends finished most of the appetizers by the time i was there but the 1s i did get to try were mind blowing. also ...their sauces are out of this world (especially this black bean sauce). i do not remember the name of the items but we had a fish a beef a chicken and noodles. each of them were perfect in their own way although i thought the noodles cud improve a wee bit. the fish (fish with black beans think) was the best. we all thoroughly loved the meal but my friends kept saying the appetizers (which i misssed) were better than the main course. Overall it was a great experience. i simply loved it. oh and the place is gorgeous and very well maintained. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
Very Nice Environment but waiter response very slow . Food is good but not best .

Had a dinner reservation for 3 and after reading several of the reviews on the page and suggestions from family and friends, decided to have a Dim Sum night. Placed 6 orders of various Dim Sums. The first one to arrive was the Steamed Spicy Glass Noodle Dumplings which were average, not my preference. I was quite taken away by the Steamed Mushroom and Herb Dumplings, sort of reminded me of the mushroom momos from Crepe o Momo. That's the end of vegetarian dishes and now my fa...vorite, the meat dim sums. The Chicken and Prawn Sui Mai were tasty, a little hot and would order again. The Beef Cheung Fung looked tastier than it really was. A friend described the taste as a savoury lychee. On the other hand the Crispy Prawn Cheung Fung was the highlight of the night and ended up ordering two of those. The last order was a Prawn and Water Chestnut Dumplings which I devoured with complete satisfaction. At the end of the night, I was full and content. To accompany the dim sum was still water, and service was normal, nothing extraordinary. Overall good dining experience, loved the decor and would visit again.
Really a good Chinese restaurant..... Environment is nice...and food quality also fine. Various kinds of Chinese cuisine you can try. So don't be late. Just check them out now.

Their iftaar is too much expensive and the quantity is very much disappointing. Here in BD we can avail the Buffet ifter along with dinner in Tk 1800/1600 or even in 1200 , where the Chows iftaar ( one plate set ) is 1400 and ++ goes to Tk 1700+. I don't know why they have chosen the Ramadan for their plunderage and we are encouraging them by taking the part of that dishonesty !

Food is honestly good, but i only rate 2 stars because your credit card line wasn't working!!! A restaurant if this stature and prices should expect to have redundancies for credit card/debit card processing facilities.
Excellent food, great service. Will definitely recommend to others.

The dumplings were quite good but our main course was a big disappointment (we had chicken with cashewnut and Xo sauce and prawn with garlic and chilli). And they had mosquito coil burning when we walked in...first few minutes at the table waiting for some fresh air was not pleasant experience!
Very poor Service .... This restaurant dnt know how to deal with their customer ... People who have enough time and prefer to eat cold food thn this is the right restaurant for them..

Waited an hour and a half for cold food and the waiter was very rude. There were 3 kids with us and he claimed our order was "poor" for 9 people. We asked repeatedly for the manager who never came. No discounts or apologies. The table opposite us was so furious with the service they yelled and did not touch their food and left. 5 of us said we would never come back.
Loved the food and the ambience....definitely recommended.
Best Chinese food in town! Beautiful ambiance, very good service. Would love to go back and refer to my friends and family.
Interior is beautiful. Dim sum is very good. Quantity is terrible compared to the price for the mains. Service is okay.
Horrible service. The server forgot to bring two of our ordered items not once but twice! I was very disappointed.
Guys get a high chair, not everyone has a nanny or carries a stroller everywhere you know ! Food is on point, however Nutella pao is overrated .

The place is awesome.. Love the interior n d ambience! Impressed with the service as well..Crispy beef was delicious and the chicken n crab dimsum were good too.. Other items were ok.. Expected a lot more from nutella pao. The food can be better. Over all an ok experience.
I was informed about CHOWS from one of my friend. Went there and found an excellent experience. Keep it up. Wish you a good luck!

we went to Chow following much hype regarding the food and so forth. Unfortunately turns out as following (1) waiters are very poorly trained regarding assistance during placing order and also hearing out on table preference. (2) food is not of much good/better taste then of recently opened other similar restaurants (3) Waiter's advice on the portions were HORRIBLE Highly discourage visits to Chow not only for the service but also for the taste of food.

Going through your Facebook page, nowhere does it say that you have to make prior reservations. My husband and I went to Chows on Friday night, and we were literally turned out because we had no reservations! I see from one of your reviews that another customer had the same complaint. This level of customer service is unacceptable! As a regular food connoisseur, I'd suggest that you teach your staff customer relations because no amount of glitz and glamour will get you loyal customers if your restaurant has abominable customer service!!!
Good food,good environment.Enjoyed very much
Best dim sums ever! Great ambience and well behaved staff. Good job guys!

Really great Chinese food. The sweet and sour chicken made my day! Love the design of the interior, the natural light from the large glass windows, the music, the ambience. The waiters were very polite as well. Keep it up!

I made a reservation at Chows and went their with my foreign guests. Went I called them to reserve a table they told me that the last order was at 3pm however they will consider my foreign guests and still serve us lunch after hours. When I went there with my guests they literally shut the door on our face and refused us to enter the restaurant. They should have never accepted our reservation if they were unable to serve. They don't have basic human decency. I even told them ...that my Chinese guests would just like to look around even if they cant serve us lunch. Still they shut the door on our faces. How can they be so rude to customers when they will have no business without us. I sincerely advice them to learn how to operate a restaurant and teach their staff basic manners. There are number of Chinese restaurants in Dhaka so don't think that your restaurant is any special.

I've been a huge fan of this place since it opened doors a few years back in Banani..however my recent experience has not been too well..i was served stale 'tokyo fried rice'..i was disappointed that they even served it..i had eaten half of the rice, and they later replaced it..but i was through with dinner, so didnt need the replaced rice..its just a disappointment that after a while people start compromising with quality once they get established. kindly address this issue, and try not to compromise with the standards which YOU have set yourself!!

The people of Tokyo Express have turned to thievery these days. It was bad enough that the service has gone to hell and that the food portions have decreased in size, they have also turned to stealing your food. Went there today with the family and there was a lot of food left over so we asked them to pack it for us. Got home and saw that all the left over sushi was not there. They didn't pack it. Packed everything else but the sushi. Really disgusting to think that they either ate it or they were going to serve it to the next customer. Really appalling Tokyo Express.
