I lived japan two years. That time i was falling in love for Sushi. Every weekend I ate lot of sushi. Last year i came back to bd, and thought in my entire life i will not eat sushi as good as sushi meijin in japan. But I was surprised to eat shamon sushi in Tokyo express, that was exactly same taste like sushi meijin in japan. But honestly speaking it is too expensive than japan, whereas japan was one of the most expensive country in the world, Thier food cost, labour cost is too high. But In bd why sushi price is too expensive compare to rice and beef sysling I don't understand. Whatever the sushi was too good. I am so happy to have it.

At that time we r taking pictures they told us nothing bt turned off lights ac even also closed the door..just got shocked by their behavior.what kind of bad Manner is this?? Worst ever experience of dining out at Tokyo Express in Gulshan! With high expectations I took my daughters to have dinner tonight there.I wish I never had gone there . I have tried almost all of the renowned restaurants in Dhaka but this was a nightmare.The service is horribly bad, food came late beyond one can expect Finally when it came, the main dish we crazed for never arrived. We just waited to see what was happening.It wasn't served till the last! Amazingly when the bi...ll came, we were charged also for the dish we never had. The person serving was most inexperienced, ill mannered & paid no attention to our needs. We don't eat free, we pay a lot of money for eating out. I will also complain to the CAB for such managements! The owners of Tokyo express should be more careful in providing services to their customers . I shall never ever go to this place and would highly recommend everyone to think not twice but many many times before going to this restaurant. I had terrible experience tonight ! Thanks to Tokyo express!!!!!

Decided to pay Tokyo Express a visit - took us few minutes to find the place. If you are coming from Gulshan-Banani Brdige-end Just do a left on Road 9 then take the first right. Restaurant is on the ground floor and before you reach the main entrance you pass a few tables occupied by mostly university student types and smokers. As I went in, first thing I noticed is that the restaurant has very poor acoustics and was very loud - specially the inside rooms. I asked the Waite...r to explain the menu as he did, I was unable to understand half of what he said - problem with both his English and Bangla pronunciation. The decor was average, Steel cutleries already showing wear and narrow ends of chopsticks are worn out тАУ the shiny coating has come off exposing the wood like material. Tokyo Express should provide disposable or better quality chopsticks as micro food particles can easily stick to the exposed material. We were just given one small empty sauce bowl for our soy sauce/wasabi mix to dunk our sushi - there were two of us and they should have given us two sauce bowl as I personally do not like to share my sauce bowl with others. We ordered the the assorted sushi dish, Chicken Nanban and Osaka spicy beef and fried rice. The Sushi tasted quite good 2 pieces each - of prawn, cuttlefish and salmon. The sushi rice could be of better quality. This would make the sushi extremely good. Chicken Nanban is an average dish but was quite delicious. Made with ice cube sized chicken breast pieces on a light sauce. Sauce tasted like Oyster sauce with soy sauce and sugar added in. A very plain dish. Osaka spicy beeft also tasted very nice - dry shredded beef cooked in hot and light teriyaki sauce and spring onion. The dish was quite tasty. Fried rice also tasted nice but seemed just a tad bit oily. Cooked in less oil the dish would taste just as good. The watermelon juice was average; it was naturally sweet but lacked body and volume. Bill was just above Taka 2000. For the price Tokyo express is a good value with decent food. Although I was not wowed by any of the dishes, I was not disappointed either. Definitely recommended for sushi (at least for the price) and casual lunch and dinner. The menu choice is very limited; I would advice the owners to add more items. >M.M
We took the Chicken Canban(?),Sushi,Osaka (?) Beef, Giant Prawn Tempura and Tokyo Fried Rice.Food was good,liked it.The chicken was best!

Great food. Imbuing dishes with a seasonal feel and bringing out the natural flavors of the ingredients are very important parts of this style of Japanese cuisine......Tokyo Express successfully done it. The restaurant- wait staff are all very polite and treat diners with exceptionally thoughtful hospitality.Their deep admiration of the seasons and warm thoughtfulness towards the customer reflects a sense of aesthetics that prizes tranquility and simplicity.

I don't know what happened 4 months ago with all these negative reviews. Sbarro had always been my most favorite pizzeria in Bangladesh. I'm almost a regular in this shop. I'm a big fan of their Gulshan outlet. Tobay I visited their Bailey Road outlet. Mr. Masud Rana served me all the way with kind and good professionalism. I ordered 1 NY cheese, 1 NY chicken tikka, 1 NY hot & spicy and 2 Iced lemon tea (My all time favourite). All of them tasted really good. Specially the NY...

Worst sehri-outing experience I had till date. Yesterday afternoon, I called up the baily road branch and reserved seats for nine people. The staff member who talked to me had confirmed and assured me that the reservation was placed. At 2:15 AM when we actually arrived at the restaurant, we got to know that this reservation was never communicated to the sehri shift staff member. Kudos to them for their great professionalism :) But this was only the start. They served us the first plate at 3:27 AM, a mere 11 minutes before the sehri deadline. We waited for more than an hour thinking that okay they didn't communicate the reservation among themselves but surely a franchise like Sbarro will be able to serve up some platters in 30- 40 minutes. We were dead wrong. Even after taking such a long time, they didn't serve the full platter. Barely half of the offerings were plated in front of us. Sadly, all these things weren't the most pathetic part of the experience. This sham of a restaurant they are running didn't even have spoons! Yes, a restaurant without spoons. We had rush-eat rice with a fork and a knife. With 11minutes till the sehri deadline.

It was our first visit to Sbarro, Mohammadpur branch... The first thing that impressed us was the hospitality of the staffs, specially Mr.Sunny... This all-time smiley faced person was very polite and friendly... We ordered Stuffed Crust Pizza with sausages and pepperoni and Iced Tea... Pizza was delicious and juicy and the Iced Tea was simply awesome... Thanks to Sbarro Bangladesh for giving us the original taste of Sbarro... :-)

took that 12 inch new york cheese pizza with wedges and ice tea offer at tk 1000. Pizza tasted rubbish.Wost pizza that I've ever had. Had worst experience at khilgaon branch today. Pizza crust was damn hard, hardly any cheese. Ice lemon tea had no ice, when asked for ice told that ice is finished. Wedges were 8-9 pieces only and we had to wait for this shitty foods for more than an hour. Waiter forgot what we ordered and around half hour later came to us and asked what we want again! We were much excited, as Sbarro opened new in Khilgaon. But if this the service and food quality, no need for it here.

Worst sehri-outing experience I had till date. Yesterday afternoon, I called up the baily road branch and reserved seats for nine people. The staff member who talked to me had confirmed and assured me that the reservation was placed. At 2:15 AM when we actually arrived at the restaurant, we got to know that this reservation was never communicated to the sehri shift staff member. Kudos to them for their great professionalism :) But this was only the start. They served us the first plate at 3:27 AM, a mere 11 minutes before the sehri deadline. We waited for more than an hour thinking that okay they didn't communicate the reservation among themselves but surely a franchise like Sbarro will be able to serve up some platters in 30- 40 minutes. We were dead wrong. Even after taking such a long time, they didn't serve the full platter. Barely half of the offerings were plated in front of us. Sadly, all these things weren't the most pathetic part of the experience. This sham of a restaurant they are running didn't even have spoons! Yes, a restaurant without spoons. We had rush-eat rice with a fork and a knife. With 11minutes till the sehri deadline.
we ordered for 8"inch pizza but they gave us 6"inch pizza. The taste wasn't really good enough and their pizza was less cheesy which wasn't expected either

I don't know what happened 4 months ago with all these negative reviews. Sbarro had always been my most favorite pizzeria in Bangladesh. I'm almost a regular in this shop. I'm a big fan of their Gulshan outlet. Tobay I visited their Bailey Road outlet. Mr. Masud Rana served me all the way with kind and good professionalism. I ordered 1 NY cheese, 1 NY chicken tikka, 1 NY hot & spicy and 2 Iced lemon tea (My all time favourite). All of them tasted really good. Specially the NY... hot & spicy (Definitly recommended). Sbarro always served the most fresh dough or crust. It felt soft and well baked. They use just the amount of cheese the pizza needs. They do well with the pizza sauce they use. Perfect tasting pepperoni. Well seasoned. Not everyone is going to love all of the pizza flavours. But I think you'll definitly find one you'd love. I have jsut a small issue with the Iced lemon tea. Except mohammadpur and maybe dhanmondi outlet, I've been to every other one. In the original Gulshan outlet they use huge beer mugs for the Iced lemon tea. But in some other outlets you'll find them using thin narrow glasses to serve the lemon tea which is sad. And the taste varries from outlet to outlet. The taste is like a hit or miss. They should try to fix that. And I liked the fact that only they had their one signature 18" sized pizzas in BD. I hated it when they started introducing different sizes for their pizza. Well, it's just me complaining. Happy feasting.

It was our first visit to Sbarro, Mohammadpur branch... The first thing that impressed us was the hospitality of the staffs, specially Mr.Sunny... This all-time smiley faced person was very polite and friendly... We ordered Stuffed Crust Pizza with sausages and pepperoni and Iced Tea... Pizza was delicious and juicy and the Iced Tea was simply awesome... Thanks to Sbarro Bangladesh for giving us the original taste of Sbarro... :-)

I often visit SBARRO Uttara, and they have amazing service! ItтАЩs easily my favourite pizzeria in Bangladesh. The manager is extremely nice and generous! He even offered us some complimentary extra food. If you have time and are looking for great food, great service, and an amazing environment, definitely come here!

The NY Style pizza was as thin as a loaf. They have charged 90/- per glass of soft drinks. Worst pizza I've experienced and also invoiced service charge of 50/-. I strongly recommend to avoid this pizza shop.

I went to Gulshan sbbaro thrice where the food was very good and high quality. But for last 4 times I went to Baily road outlet.Extremely unprofessional staff.DonтАЩt even know how to perfectly bake a strombly. Every time itтАЩs raw inside.For a chain shop like this where we are paying a lot and getting undone food this is just not done.Sbbaro was one of my favourite place but for these bad services I donтАЩt think I will ever dine in there.You should do something with your service.

worst pizza ever, if anyone want to waste money then they should come here. they say there pizza is 8 inch but we measure it 6 inch also less topping you can say no toping at all. Street pizza would be best than sbarro pizza

Heard a lot about Sbarro, but never went there in last 2 years. When I saw the opening post (after the BESTever QR Code campaign and BEST quality Facebook post design), I, along with 3 other friends went to the Asad Avenue Outlet. As it is the soft launching phase, so I am not judging them based on their service. This is all about FOOD QUALITY. The crust was as thick as pillow (ржмрж╛рж▓рж┐рж╢). The closest competitor in terms of crust thickness would be Captain's World (which I had ...when Ashraful was our Cricket Captain and always regretted before today). Apart from the crust, the pizza was TASTELESS. Maybe you might think I have too Bangali a taste bud, but I never wrote bad review about any place. Yes, I have never been to NY but I have been to Europe 2 times. I am this furious because I have spent BDT 2550 for 1 KG of plain flour crust. Sorry, I could not take it.

I went to the mohammadpur branch before the opening day only to try out the pizza. They said only 4 pizzas were available,the rest will come after 5th October,the opening day. So we had a pizza which was available and it was good. Then they provided us with some coupons and told that we'll get 20% discount on these items till 15th October. Then again we went there after the day of opening and showed them the coupon but the servers said that those items were not available. The...y also said if I want to use these coupons and want to have that meal I have to go to another outlet as the mohammadpur outlet didn't have those meals. I mean it is already opened! Why does it still don't have combos and other things available? Every outlet has launched together so every outlet should also have same pizzas and other items available! You guys should take care of that. Otherwise the pizza was good.

As usual NY cheese, NY mushroom & chicken tikka hold their top position in my favorite list. Keep it up Sbarro. Good news: Sbarro is launching 8 more branches around Dhaka city soon. So, it's a request to Sbarro team, please always try to maintain the same quality as they are now. Cause many renowned pizza restaurants have degraded their quality gradually for profit.
well i decided to give you 4 star but for MR.SHAJIB'S service I put 1 extra star here. and pizza was amazing as always.

[I did not have Sbarro's food so my review is based on their service only] Earlier today I messaged Sbarro asking if they took any reservations, and they replied saying that they did not in fact take any reservations and that it's on first come first serve basis. Which seemed fine to me. When I went there later on today, it was jam packed with people as expected but what surprised me was when the guard asked me if I had a reserved table or not. And then one of the waiters as...ked me the same thing as well. Lots of people were still going inside because they had reserved their seats and I just stood there surprised that they denied taking reservations earlier today and lo and behold they actually did take reservations. In the end me and my siblings had to dine elsewhere. This kind of confusing service is extremely disappointing, especially coming from Sbarro which is widely lauded to have amazing service. And this was our first time there too. My question is this, if you did take reservations then why deny that fact to a potential customer?

They make the strongest crusts in town. I mean you can literally hurt people with the slices of pizzas, they are so hard!!! The layer of cheese is so thin that it can easily beat Megan Fox's hip. On the positive side, The slices were colder than their AC for sure. Chilling experience in a hot weather!!! You can also eat the slices upside down. ... Don't worry, the toppings are glued, so they won't fall off. What a trick to impress your girlfriend!!! Ofcourse, if you have one. A slice of cold, hard, ruti with little less harder toppings. Even the garlic mushroom had too much garlic!!! Pepsi was literally the best thing on your menu!!! On a serious note, if you are charging 220+vat for a slice, i expect quality!!! You are branding pizzas and serving absolute disappointment.

ok place to hang out and eat a lot of pizza! air conditioning needs a bit work though. service average, food slightly above average, tried almost all types, loved some hated some so you get the picture.

So no complaints about the food which was excellent or the price which I found reasonable. But the staff have massive problems communicating with the customer or operating the sales counters. So this afternoon I head in, the place is nearly empty and I ask for a stromboli that isnt vegetables based. Four different staff offer me three kinds of vegetable based stromboli for ten minutes before one of them realizes I want a meat based stromboli and apologizes that they don't ha...ve any, wasting 10 minutes of my life. Then I head to the counter to pay, at which point the girl behind the counter presses buttons on the computer for several minutes before realising that the counter doesn't work. She apologizes. I ask her if I should go to my seat and wait for them to bill me or whether I should leave the note with her and wait for them to give me the change. She apologizes, I repeat my question. Other waiters join her in apologizing. A small crowd of apologetic waiters gather around me as I ask my question seven times and get seven rounds of apologies from more and more waiters. Then someone figures out that they can open the counter with the key that's next to the counter. At which point they take my Tk 500 note and give me my 30 Tk in change in three torn 10Tk notes, all three of which were scotch taped down the centre. At this point I should have known better than to ask, but I went ahead and asked for a pizza sauce to go with the pizza. I recieved three boxes of chilli powder/paprika from four different waiters before someone figured out what sauce was. 2/10 for service.

MCafe amazed us by the intricately beautiful and unequaled interior. It is in line with music (M for Music) cafe concepts of the West. The music theame made it unique with walls covered by photos and quotes of great singers. Every wall and corner is like a studio wall and corner, ideal for photography, particularly selfie. MCafe satisfied to know that, hospitality is not about inviting people into our perfect home, itтАЩs all about inviting them into our imperfect Heart. Really nice place for food lover with stunning musical environment.
Had a good time today... with some really old friends... n the food was good....

The Blissful BBQ Bash of m cafe costing 300 TK. The presentation of the food was good but they can improve it,well the taste of the food was not up to the mark.The rice tastes good but the quantity of it needs to be increased,the salad that they gave I think it should be sliced more thickly then it would have been better. On the other hand the BBQ ckicken was perfect, according to me it was perfectly cooked, in each an every bite the juicy flavoured of the chicken could be felt ,the BBQ sauce was a perfect combination with it.So over all it was not up to the mark of the pricing stratagy,the pricing should be around 230-250 TK. I know that a cafe have some overhead costs but still charging 300 TK on it, makes the food expensive comparing to the taste and quantity.

Wish could give a higher rating !!! We had an office party there on 22 Dec 17 of 30 guests. We needed separate seating arrangements for gents and ladies with different aged kids. They just did what I wanted. Even they kept one separate room for mothers who need to feed their babies. As it was Christmas season, so the hall was superbly decorated. The seating arrangement was not that quite but sufficiently spacious. About food, they were exceptional in case of choosing items i...n comparison to other hotels who offer the buffet of the same price range. They did not have 2/3 types Biriyani/ Rice items or any other similar food. There was no duplication of any menu. Starter items like soup and other snacks were not typical and were delicious. Ther main attractions were Small Lobster and Beef Steak. In addition to that, they had seafood and fish items too. They had variety in dessert items which we could not try as we were almost full then. We never saw an empty dish there. Whenever it was finished they refilled it without any further delay.They maintained high standard food quality throughout. If I don't say about two persons in this review then it will be an injustice to them which I must not do. Our party was a successful one only because of Restaurant Manager Mr. Zilhaj Parvez. He made everything in a way that we all felt like home. He was always there to fulfill our every requirement. Along with him, mess waiters were also very polite and professional with a smiling face. Another person is Md. Tazul Islam, Senior Security Officer, and an Ex Military person who ensured our tension free foodie time. As there was a shortage of underground parking, we had to park our cars outside. But this man ensured us about the security and was there with his troops till last maintaining extreme professional attitude. At last, all of us came out from there with a smiley face and satisfied heart. We all will look forward to going there time and again. Hope they keep their standard up always.

Tried their buffer dinner offer. Was not expecting this! We went quite early around 7.30-8 but already all the food was cold! They warmer was not working. After mentioning it they fixed it. Worst suchi i ever tried, also with a foul smell!! But the worst was when we tried their firni it was totally sour with a foul smell. We showed it to the waiter n latter the chef confirmed that it has gone bad. They offered us another but by that time we were done! The manager was present but he didn't say anything! On the other hand the waiters and the assistant manager was nicer n more polite. Other Food items were okay, nothing extraordinary. But this type of management is not something you expect from a restaurant like this!

So told them we would be coming at 6:30pm, they said they would help us get seats when we were there. Unfortunately dhaka traffic played us and we were 2.5 hours late!! However in the meantime we had a couple of attendees already there and they accepted our order. So soon after reaching the place we got our food. The food was really good. We had the hanging chicken with rice/pasta. The chicken with rice was a really good combo (350tk) and we also found the pasta to be really good. Overall a good experiance.

We 5 friends tried The latest offer of Buy 1 get 1 free, we also wanted to order other items. But they only had the тАЬThai fried rice with chicken fry oneтАЭ, nothing else. First of all they wanted to amuse their customers by providing free food. But in that case it must be tasty or according to their description. Unfortunately it had a blunder taste. The fried chicken size was 1/3 of the given picture ones. The sizzling had hardly any chicken but full of carrots. Imagine caram... They took order of 5 cold drinks but served 4, when we asked the reason they said they ran out of cold drinks. Even they didnтАЩt have mineral water as well. Later on request they brought us a 500 ml bottle from downstairs. Now tell me in what kind of restaurants they ran out of drinking water??? It was a mistake of going after in such offers. Just thought they earlier provided good food so can give it a try. But sorry never again. я┐╜я┐╜я┐╜

I hitted 3 stars because i think overall is good. First of all I would just like to thank you for the fantastic evening we spent at your restaurant on Sunday 24th September 2017. Secondly i would like to say that I & my friends ordered BBQ chicken with Fried rice. Specially thanks for your service and your decoration was well decorated and i love that place. Your food quality was average and i didn't find any specialty from that food. Last but not least we had a great time and really appreciated the live entertainment too!тАЬ Best of luck for your restaurant...

Pizza was very good.. but pasta was worse, it was smell like cow's fat. They serve tomato sauces in a tiny plate..this is really irritating. You have to ask them several times for sauces. Overall environment was good. Staffs are sincere.

The service was so bad I can't imagine, how come they keep an offer while their microwave oven ain't working. lol it's offensive to hear but we all pay to eat right?? We'll always want the best. How come a restaurant like Cafe theatre have a single oven? If they don't have a single oven they could prepare our pizzas on the others right?? But as they had one and it wasn't working so they couldn't provide us with Pizzas!! lol I'm laughing my ass off and I'm angry like an active volcano in the same time as I've paid for the foods we had and we couldn't have what we wanted. The place is nice but their service us very poor. I think it was our bad omen that we went their to celebrate our birthday program. I won't ever go there and will tell friends too no to go there as well

So for my sister's birthday, we ordered takeout of the BBQ platter for four and got enough food to feed at least 6 people. To be honest, the food was mostly excellent. The Mexican rice was splendid. The chicken wings and the chicken sizzling were finger licking good. We found the green sauce too spicy, especially for those who can't consume spicy food. The disappointment was the BBQ chicken which weren't barbequed at all! There was no searing on the outside, the char a barbequed chicken is supposed to have was nonexistent. There was zero spice in it. Also, we found hair in several dishes which is totally unacceptable. I hope in future you'll improve your dishes more. Keep up the good work with the rice, the chicken wings and the chicken sizzling but please be more sincere about the quality and hygiene of your food.

Worst pizza ever ! Their Buy 1 get 1 pizza offer sucks. Tottally waste of money. Can you believe a pizza without cheese and meat? Yess ! They made this kind of pizza. They offered buy 1 get 1 pizza. Soi 71 at Uttara is a fine dining of Thai food bonanza at Uttara. It's located in the centre of Uttara, round about of Uttara 7, 11 & 13. The ambience of the restaurant is spectacular especially in the open area where Charcoal barbecue is done in front of the customers. It welcomes every customer individually with warm and cordial way offering mouth watering and tasty welcome drinks. The well trained staff know their job to satisfy the customers with service. Chefs know how to pamper their customer with fine dining and delicacies. The hot and spicy Tom yam soup has parallel, succulent and crispy fried chicken..... True and authentic Thai cuisine is their strength as well as pride in the city. They have wide array of the best picked Thai dishes in their menu. They won the hearts of food lovers. Cheers to Soi 71 at Uttara.

Nice Environment at Dhanmondi. Very Tasty Coffee. I like it.

best place in the town to have coffee. the place is so calm and quite, specially in the morning. the sitting arrangement the staffs are so perfect with professional behaviour. I would love to visit again and again.

Came to North End every day during a three week trip to Dhaka. We mostly frequented the location at Cityscape Tower. The ambience is welcoming and relaxed, the staff-professional and attentive, and the coffee is truly the best in Bangladesh.

This place is the best place for me.... Me n my wife started our lovely time here with the most favourite Coffee Latte wd ice cube... Such a wonderful memory I hv n hd n still continue.... The smell of raw coffee make me so cool The light n gossiping environment makes me crazy to come again n again wd my well wishers ... Excellent coffee.........

Always favorite coffee shop basis of my preferences ЁЯТХ
I had a very good experience with this place. The staff are very friendly, the menu is on point and the ambience is perfect after you have had a hectic day.

The Best Coffee in town and better than some international chains like Tim Hortons or even Costa and Starbucks! North End Coffee, especially at Cityscape, on an early weekend morning is my little piece of heaven!

I have always been a big fan of North End, but had a terrible experience today. Well, the coffee was very good as usual but the desperate effort of the staffs to close at 11 pm felt a bit weird and extremely uncomfortable. I went to North End at Cityscape tower with my Wife and Brother in law at around 10:30 pm. By that time they have already rounded up all the chairs and tables, which itself is not right if the official closing time is 11 pm. We ordered 4 cappuccino and were... waiting for our Sister to arrive.When she arrived at 11:00 pm they had already closed the sliding door. One of the staffs stopped her outside when she said my coffee has been ordered and they are waiting inside, which can be seen through the glass. The staffs kept arguing with her and given that the sliding door has already been turned off she got hurt hitting the glass door. This is sad as you feel unwelcome in a reputed coffee boutique. I personally feel this is what happens when you leave everything on the staffs. Quite a bad experience!
Yeah its really really good coffee shop in Bangladesh

Smiling-well mannered-excellent-friendly staff. like to hang around and do some reading. Still offering the same great coffee and food (brownie, Abocado sushi,Cinamonn Buns). I think the service here is better than other North Ends in the city.

North-End has been my favorite place for coffee and snacks since it opened doors years ago. Always like the aroma and ambience here, ideal for a hangout. Based on my recent visit I noticed that they have improved the interior a lot without spoiling the environment which is another reason to come back here.

My go-to place for everything coffee. I buy my coffee beans from North End. They have a good variety of beans to choose from. The brownies are excellent and so are the staff - friendly, polite and knowledgeable. I highly recommend this place for anyone who is into coffee.
Service quality is really good...the coffee they serve is best in town...but they can improve the snacks nd muffin range... overall a good coffee experience...
Best coffee, delicious bites and super attentive staff. The only place in Bangladesh where the baristas are passionate about the science and arts of coffee making.

This review regarding the home delivery service in Dhanmondi. I placed my order around 8:45pm and got it delivered at 10:40pm. They took around 2 hours to deliver the food! They always give the excuse that their delivery man is facing problems. If Pizza Inn don't have adequate delivery personnel then stop providing the home delivery service! I am never ordering through Pizza Inn home delivery service ever again! Anyone who is reading this review if you are thinking of ordering pizza for home delivery in Dhanmondi, just don't do it! Majority of the time you'll end up with extreme disappointment and cold pizza...

So I have been a customer of Pizza Inn since it started in Dhaka with their own building in Gulshan,Dhaka. I really liked eating pizza here. But what yesterday happened what just really disappointing. Look people make mistakes. I know that. I saw mistakes in Pizzas since day one. But you people improved. Then you reached the top of pizza chain (atleast to me). But yesterday's service just dragged you down to the last. So like any other day, I went with my family to eat ...pizza around 7 p.m. I sat at my usual place in second floor. Then there was this offer going on where you buy 1 large pizza and get another one absolutely free. So i ordered this BBQ Chicken classic pizza with the another one Pizza Inn Special which costed more. So obviously they took the second one as my order and the first one as the free one. It took them about 20 mins which is usual. They first gave the pizza inn special pizza. No fork or knives were in the table. They never offered one too. Then after I asked, they gave them. The waiter also had lack of knowledge about service (It was not his fault btw because he wasn't trained well. And i even tipped him well because he was really young) Then there came my usual and most favourite flavour BBQ. But it was really disappointing when i tasted the second one (BBQ). It tasted exactly like the first was. It was extremely disappointing to eat two pizzas with the same flavour even i ordered two different ones. I asked the waiter about that but he said he didn't know. I hope you review you your mistakes because I myself never expected this kind of service. My family also got disappointed which made me feel sad because I was the one to force them to eat here whilst they wanted to eat elsewhere....

A story of disappointment and deception -_- Poorest food, price and service I have ever experienced! I am totally shocked at your response to the queries of the customers. It took about 40 minutes to deliver pizzas. Almost all the items are overpriced. The pasta I ordered was not worth 475 taka at all. Also, it was almost chilled, didn't look like you cooked it after I ordered. The waiter was always confused to our questions. You put the different columns for pizzas and crusts, well fine. But why there were no thin crusts which we ordered? Your worthless waiter was insisting us to order the high priced ones! That's how the pizza wich was shown taka 660 or something turned into 990 taka! Cunning policy, indeed. Totally disappointed at your work. Never coming again.

First of all they are not worthy enough to give even one star but since this is the minimum rating, I am giving one. Their delivery is very time consuming and on top of that they more or less forced us to take their stuffed crust which is of BDT 295. They have thin crush which they don't charge extra money for but that was not available. So it clearly proves that they are taking extra money for their so called stuffed crust forcefully! Now a days customers are willing to spend extra money on good food so you don't have to steal it from us showing lame excuses. If that is your business strategy then I suggest you to develop your business skills along with your pizza taste! They wrote BDT 600++ for their medium sized pizza but they took 990 instead because of stuffed crust which is so not worth the money!

This place WAS amazing for 5-6 years straight till last year. There used to be a time when this was country's only place for pizza and pasta. The well behaved waiters they have is a feeble attempt at justifying the ludicrous food they serve for the high price they charge.

today I ordered a home delivery 1 small cheese pizza and 1 medium beef pepperoni from pizza inn (dhanmondi). The pizza came exactly cold, the cheese small size is actually a baby size pizza, no cheese at all, literally no cheese. The beef pepperoni is so salty that u have to throw it out after one bite. I love pizza inn coz they blended the taste of pizza with our food habit. Their HD never disappointed me with their delivery. We must consider the traffic that we face everyday and be considerate about any unintentional delay (when it really happens). Best of luck for pizza inn.

One of the most customer-friendly places comparative to other restaurants I have visited within Dhaka. I along with two more people went there (mirpur branch) to avail unlimited pizza offer at about 6:40 pm without even booking & obviously it was houseful. We were wandering here & there & then the manager approached to us on his own & suggested to have iftar in staff room. We agreed as there was no other option left. Dates, rooh-afza & cold drinks were quickly served & just before azaan, two slices of pizza were given to each of us. Eventually they were serving pizzas of different flavor (8 flavors) after every while & the manager was repeatedly saying sorry that we had to have iftar in staff room. Though they had to serve a lot of pizzas to a huge number of crowd but still taste was not degraded.

Worst ever service, thick bread with poor topings (they call this a pizza). We visited the Police Plaza outlet. It was our worst experience. We kept them calling with empty plates with huge appetite (we were fasting) and they didn't ever bother to come. The waiters were so mannerless! I won't recommend the place and not going there ever again.

Ordered through their online home delivery system at 01:13 p.m. and received the food at 03:15 pm. but they said it would be delivered by 02:30 p.m. When I called at 02:30 p.m. to ask about the order they informed me that the ordered had not been placed due to a server error, although I had already talked to them before that and they informed nothing then. When we asked for a discount for the horrible service, they said they would give a discount but the delivery man asked for the whole bill. First of all if i start talking about the pizza, it was almost tasteless. I ordered one of their large pizzas, and due to a running offer i got one for free. If they cannot provide good quality pizza in an offer, why do they even give such offers! Again, totally disappointed with their slow service. The waiters are not even trained well. Whenever i wanted a tissue or a drinks, they started calling each other to serve me taking 5/10 mins just to come and talk. Never going back.

Poor service. Average quality of pizza, at best they can manage. Unbelievably slow. Ordered three items and it took them one and half hour to serve it. Don't even place tissue on the table: went there with 3 people. And they place just four tissues under forks and knives. and that's it. You want more tissue, they'll listen and will be gone. Ultimately, you have to fetch them yourselves. Paid for about 4k Tk, all of which feels completely wasted on nothing.

1. The crust was really thin, almost like a Ruti. 2. Amount of cheese was not bad. 3. Among the toppings, tomatoes and onions were abundant, there was hardly any chicken even masroom in the chicken supreme pizza. You can also count the olives. 4. The overall taste was good but for 279tk, considering the toppings, it was overpriced. The making of pizza in an oven in front of you is the main attention. You can give it a try but not really a place to go back just to have the pizza. Definitely overhyped and overrated. Best of luck.

Well the crust was really thin, almost felt Like a Nun Ruti. Amount of cheese was okay. Among the toppings, tomatoes and onions were abundant in the beef pizza. Portion of beef is again okay though there was hardly any chicken in the chicken pizza. You can also count the olives. The overall taste was good for 200tk. But considering the toppings, 200 tk is not cheap rather an okay price tag. They only have 8 inch pizzas. For a guy like me, I could easily eat Two and go for ...

Last night I along with my 03 colleagues went there for buffet dinner. The items like beef or mutton curry were not up to the mark, meat lovers like us may be disappointed. 02 items of soup, fried chicken and noodles were good. Surprisingly, we found no item of prawn. We felt salads and dessert items poor and limited. I found small hair in different dishes which disturbed me a lot but I did not say anything as my mates could lose their appetite. This is by far the best pizzas I've had here at BD. Made by a man full of passion and dedication, I'd rate this a 10/10. The presentation of the pizza is beautiful. Its very neat and pleasing to the eye. I personally had the BBQ chicken pizza and the shrimp pizza and it tastes amazing. The meat is well cooked and tender. The meat alone tastes outstanding. The texture of the pizza is wonderful. Though it is layered by the sauce and meat and the cheeses on top, it still holds everything in place. It doesnt get soggy or soft which is essential for a good pizza. And not to forget, every bite gives you a very satisfying cheese pull which is to die for ЁЯШН Overall, i would highly recommend.

A person who knows me can tell that I just live for good food and I love eating at different places where it is a 5 star or anything else. The Friday brunch of Four Points by Sheraton is awesome to treat yourself after a hectic week. It is a place which is very soothing and their staffs will make sure that you'll feel cozy there. I have been to Le M├йridien, Westin and Raddison too but if you ask me which place serves you the best food then I'll say it is Four Points by Sherat...on. Now let's talk about the food, the best thing they will serve you is live juice station from the entire brunch session. The live kitchen has a variety of items to offer and to me the prawn tempura and the omelette with cheese were the best. They also serve you live pasta station. I had the best white sauce pasta with cheese, spices and chicken today. It was so yummy that I had the desire to start licking the plate. The main dishes were yummy too. The main thing is they will set a line of main dishes that you will want to eat like no dishes you'll not want to eat. I had a very good experience today there and I highly recommend this place.

And most importantly, though the advertisement mentions the Buffet price to be 3542 ( all inclusive), what has not been mentioned is that this excludes all beverages including water which will be charged at an exhorbitant rate plus 26.5% extra VAT and service charge on that. Located at the heart of the modern part of Dhaka, just at Gulshan-2 circle. the 28-floored Doreen Tower has been modified as this hotel. They have started new, some of their staffs I met have been recruited from other hotels like Westine, Amari etc. and they know well how provide service to customers. Their restaurant and food menus I experienced found very selective and well cooked. Restaurant is in 24th floor with good view of outside. Specially their restaurant lounge at 27th floor will give you a splendid beautiful overview of the city which must be liked by all to have some time there to drink, smoke or to dine with nearest ones, so don't miss it!

Quality of food - 3/5 Presentation - 4/5 Authenticity/Originality of food (Srilankan Cuisine) - 2/5 Taste - 2/5 (used to be better) Price (value for food) - 1/5... Environment - 3/5 Staff - 4/5 Overall - 2.5-3/5 Food we(4) ate on 20.1.2017. Kottu Roti - very good Yellow Rice - averate Chicken red curry - not near to srilankan style cyrry which i had at srilanka. It was more like Bangla style. Beef Nugamba or something (cant remember the name) - same as chicken curry. Although a bit different but doesn't have any srilankan touch. Moju - very good. The food was really good when I went there on the 1st month of their opening.
Very nice environment. Good to be home!!!

For the 1st time I test Sri Lankan food and this is amazing experience. Coconut Toffee is just like haven and the smell of Butter Cake , too much good. test of Lemonade is little bit different then regular Lemonade. Fiery Wings is also good. The owner welcome us with a smile and ask abut the quality and the test of the food. and he is concern about our comfort. The staff is so well behaved ... Overall i like this place
Peaceful ambience. Food is tasty and has great quantity. Totally will go again.

That was the first time for all of us. We were 3 in numbers. As heard before, we went there in quest for a bit spicy food. And they stood perfectly up to our expectations. The ambiance totally goes with the Sri Lankan theme. It was very homely and cozy. We had a great meal. Last, but not the least, the icing of the cake was.. the complimentary ice creams. I wish Taste of Lanka the very Best Wishes.

A real, "authentic" taste of Lanka. Though a bit expensive, but no compromise with taste and quality. Grilled Prawn, Devilled Chicken and Coconut Ice Cream was best! Devilled Fish was unavailable but I bet it would be the better dish if they have it available. I would like to taste the Giant Crab next time.

This was my first time trying out Sri Lankan food with my school friends, and what an amazing experience it was. The explosion of flavours in the Nigambo Beef Curry, the yellow rice and the Beef Kottu is how I would remember my first Sri Lankan meal. 3 of us attended for lunch. The decor was minimalist but clean. The waiters were pleasant but need proper training. As this is a new cuisine for most of us, we had to ask for recommendations. This was not voluntarily offered. Even after we advised them of our lack of knowledge about Sri Lankan food. The waiter appeared to suggest the most expensive dishes as opposed dishes that we'd like considering we were describing what we were in the mood for. Ordering the food was a chal...lenge. We ordered a set menu they had available as this would provide the most selection. We also ordered parathas, egg hoppers and a beef curry. The waiters did not make suggestions that we'd need to order this additional food but it was essential for a full meal. It took over 20 minutes for the food to arrive. Once it did, I admit it was tasty but most of it was very spicy. We were not aware of this. We can handle spice but we still would've appreciated the waiters making us aware of it. The staff mentioned 3/4 of our way through the meal that we had two drinks which came with the set menu that we'd ordered. Whether this was done to make us order more drinks or whether the waiters forgot....both are unattractive. The set menu was priced in a manner I would say appropriate but the curry was overpriced. It cost just under 4000tk for 3 of us and in all consideration, this was a tad over what we would've felt was appropriate. I hope the suggestions are considered thoughtfully. I enjoyed the food so we shall be back, inshallah.
The food was fantastic ,too spicy,too yummy я┐╜ I'll visit you again я┐╜я┐╜

I have been with BFC's food since 2004.for me BFC chicken is the best in the town.I have visited almost all the branches in Dhaka and know many outlet managers those who are working for the last 20 years.But it is really sad to say, BFC, Mirpur 10 branch has got some problems. I have been there several times since I have shifted my residence in Mirpur. The staffs are not well mannered. I have shared some of them, incident 1: one... day they have served me wrong drinks, when i objected the waiter said, it is not possible. incident 2: sometime a portion of the total area is blocked, i requested manager, he ignored. last incident: When a half of the sweet corn are eaten i have found some parts of a steel dish washing net inside, I complained they wanted to give another but i said no.The young outlet Manager was in front of me turned around even saying sorry.I was horrified about thinking their cleaning stuff.Hope authority will frequent visit their outlets and will check hygienic food ,cooking stuff and customers feedback's.DROPBOX is the better idea.and managers should be well trained., so that other staffs can perform better.

My first review consisted of 5 stars but today, I am bound to revise my review & mark it with 1 star. I am incredibly annoyed with the quantity & the quality of the food items which they provided from their Dhanmondi branch. I ordered online through pathao food. I ordered their platter, R2, & it seemed to me that I paid 2500+ taka for a mere box of French fries!!! I had the same platter twice, before, but they have seemingly deteriorated the quality & lowered the quantity of ...their food items. Probably, they re-use the oil in which they fry their items. There was a distinct smell of used oil. The fish fingers were unbelievably thin & small. I just could see French fries throughout the box & the calamaries & shrimps were very few in numbers. In Ramadan too, I experienced the same thing. I had enough of Manhattan Fish Market. Never ever going back there or ordering food online from them. They literally have lost a regular customer.

Poor service. Pathetic staff and manager.

Yesterday's azan was at 6.46 PM. The restaurant had served tang and iced tea beforehand. After the azan, everyone around us had food, except 3 tables. I figured they'd be 4/5 mins late. But nope, we waited there till 7.05 PM and got no food, while there was a table of around 15 people who'd received their second servings by that time. One time, a waiter came to our table with food, we got really excited because we'd been somewhat fasting for an extra 15 minutes, but then the ...waiter went back because that food wasn't for our table; such a tease, innit. At around 7 PM while everyone there was eating their fish and chips and we were sitting with our glass of iced tea, they brought us some really unappetizing, complementary soup. I lost it at that point and asked why they are seating people if they can't make enough food. To which they replied "Amra chai na kono customer mon kharap koruk." Bro you aren't serving people food for iftar, I think that's enough for me to "mon kharap." So then we left the place, as soon as we get on the lift they say "Apnader food chole ashche." As if I'm ever going back. We went to BFC and had super wholesome fried chicken. No ragrets, but f u, The Manhattan FISH MARKET Bangladesh. There was more weird shit before this, of course. I'd asked on Facebook whether or not the restaurant takes reservations, and they'd replied that they don't have any booking system in their outlets. They said that they serve people on a "first come, first serve" basis so it'd be best if we show up at least 45 minutes before iftar. I called the number given on your Facebook page and website again today at around 3 pm to check if you really don't take bookings. The cellphone was switched off. So we went to the Dhanmondi outlet at 5 PM today, and they told us they couldn't seat two people because all seats were booked. I told them that whoever manages their social media doesn't know that they take bookings, and if I show up at 5 at a virtually empty restaurant that serves iftar "first come, first get," then I should get a table. Then they found us a table, lol. They took our order for an iftar platter at around 6 pm. After 15 minutes or so, they came to confirm it, and their receipt had the items "garlic mussels, water" whereas we'd ordered fish and chips and chicken tenders. We told them that they'd taken a completely wrong order for some reason. I mean, I'd understand if they'd thought we ordered grilled fish instead of fried, but mussels???? What??? But then we got no food at all because MUSSELS KHAIBI NA TOH MANHATTAN FISH MARKET AISOS KEN

This was my first visit to MFM and my experience was awful. I ordered chicken mussels calamari and for drinks I ordered sunset by the bay and lemongrass cooler. The spice in the mussels was not good at all. The only good thing was the fries. I would not recommend this place for anything. We ordered coleslaw which was not served and thank God for that. We had some issues with the bill as well. They should improve the sincerity to their customers.

We ordered their bowl-less pasta which is quite hyped these days. We had to wait for over 30 mins and their waiters were acting like the last nabab of bengal and it was hard to get their attention but everything was compensated when the food arrived. The pasta was exquisite, well cooked pasta mixed with few pieces of chicken and sausage with a well balanced sauce and cheese, the crust was crunchy and went quite well with the cream, cheese and other bits as well. Overall the whole thing was a beautiful package of bursting tastes that will explode in your mouth. To me, the food of a restaurant has the highest priority that's why I had to give it 5 stars, if i take their service into consideration, I might have given them 0. Happy fooding all!

Last food experience was horrible! I was craving for chicken cashew nut salad & thus ordered this from them, along with a set menu via Hungrynaki. The cashew nut salad which they provide with their set menu is completely different from that of the individual dish. I haven't, in my whole, tasted such disgusting chicken cashew nut salad. It smells like beguni & pakora. They fry extemely thin & mini slices of chicken,(almost invisible), by covering them up with a huge amount of ...besan & flour which is responsible for this weird smell. There was abnormal thick coating in each of the chicken slices. The cashew nut salad which they provide with the set menu atleast contains capicum slices but the individual dish contains onions & cucumber only! Horrible...horrible experience. My craving was being killed by their food & I literally threw it away. They should & must stop cheating people by coating up their meat pieces with unnecessary amount of besan & flour to make them look bigger. I had the same experience with one of their beef items. The quality of their wrapped prawns has deteriorated too. There is too much of noodles & the prawns are incredibly thin & small. & the dish is too try but previously their wrapped prawns were juicy. I used to order from them a lot via Hungrynaki but the last time made me too disappointed with the quality of their dishes & have decided not to order from them anymore since you get only fried besan & flour.

Ami aj'k khabar order korsi " HAKKA KITCHEN " theke.. Normally ami review dei na.. Khabar order kore kheye feli.. Kintu aj'k oder aikhan theke khabar anaye kheye mone hoilo.. Aak review to banta hai.. я┐╜я┐╜ Shorbo prothom bolte chai.. Oder home delivery "FREE".. jei shobdo 'ta amar kichhu kinte gele kenar shomoi shunle khushi hoye jai.. я┐╜я┐╜ r akta jeita hoilo "NO vat" all including.. я┐╜я┐╜ So dui 'ta bepar 'e achhe.. Shudhui khabarer bill 'ta pay korte hobe.. Uufff extra koto gula ...tk baicha gelo oikhane jawar vara shoho я┐╜я┐╜ .. Aibar boli khabar niye.. Ami order korechhi oder set menu theke "TAKE AWAY - 2" ..jei khane achhe.. 1. Vegetable Egg Fried Rice - 4.9/5 (valoi kintu я┐╜) 2. Fried Chicken (1piece) - 4.7/5 (Uummm yum я┐╜) 3. Spicy Cashew Nut Chicken - 4.8/5 (beshi joss я┐╜я┐╜ specially jokhon crispy cashew nuts gula mukhe burst kore я┐╜я┐╜) 4. Mixed Vegetables - 4.5/5 ( Nice я┐╜я┐╜) R shathe pachhen akta yummy "chili sauce" free я┐╜я┐╜ So overall it's a very good package that you can get in.. only " 250/- " ..wow я┐╜я┐╜ So guys you can try it.. я┐╜я┐╜ And a complete 5я┐╜ goes for their hospitality.. я┐╜я┐╜ Awesome experience.. я┐╜я┐╜

Hello ! Im from banasree and kind of a frequent customer of baba rafi branch . Last couple of times i had a common problem in this branch. They are not willing to take order as per my choice from the given menu but i had to take the foods what they want due to their manpower or some other reason. Today also the same thing happened . There is a new menu launched Chicken quesadilla and i wanted to order but they are not taking this order as it will take time and i agreed to wait but still they wont coz its not easy for them to make ! My question is why you keep such item on menu when you are not taking the order and have to order as u want when u have a menu?? This is not common for other branch of baba rafi . We had the following (opposite NSU main gate 1 & 2): 1 Beef Burger = 99 Taka. Was pretty good. Loved the buns they use. The patty was good for the price range, despite being doused with a lot of sauce. Also, it is a very messy burger so make sure you get tissues. 2 Chicken Burgers = 198 Taka. The chicken burger is definitely the best item on the menu. Delicious patty which complements the soft sesame buns. They use the same sauces for both the beef and chicken burgers. Howeve...r, the sauce combo tastes much better with the chicken patty. 1 Beef Kebab = 99 Taka. The packaging is nice, the kabab wrap is decent. It is definitely not worth getting this for 99 taka. Also, the beef kebab has star anise in it, so if you don't like the smell of star anise, stay away from it! 1 Chicken Kebab = 99 Taka. Again, the chicken version is much better than the beef version. Still not worth 99 taka IMO. The meat to veggie ratio is waaaay off. They need to put more meat in this to be worth 99 taka. Tastes pretty good though. 1 Mountain Dew = 60 Taka. Regular fountain drink glass (not the tiny ones they give you at KFC or other places). Expensive yes, however it was pretty refreshing. Tasted like proper mountain dew (not some watered down version of it). Recommendations = stick to the chicken burgers. Definitely worth it!

went to Baba rafi 300 feet Bashundhara r/a they only serve 100 and 160 tk combo burger deal! One of the best burger in that price,, but i have to give points to fries,,its similar to Mcdonalds fries and Hungry Jacks i had in Australia. Beef Burger was juicy and the sauce they used was really nice with a hint of Garlic Im gonna be honest, i had most amount of burgers around dhaka from banani, malibag and mirpur, dhanmondi and 300 feet... Baba rafi beats all in price and taste and with excellent cooked fries! Top quality. Thats why i had two burgers!! N.B- every place we been to, customer service is never satisfactory, but this girl in baba rafi,,,she was kind, explainable and also served with smile where she was wearing hijab and with decency,,,5star for because she did that. Thanks for the experience. keep up the good work!

Tune & Bite Music Cafe Khilgaon is one of the most popular places to hang out in the Heart of Dhaka for all types of party lovers. This is an ideal place to hang out with Friends or passing a good time with Family Members. They has Distinct Seating Areas including a live music court. The eye-catching lounge is perfectly built friend gatherings or every types of family programs . It is the epitome of class and elegance, with interiors adorned by famous singers photo and maxim.... Interiors are superfluous with best rolling Stone magazines cover backdrop, the kitchen is really hygienic and the washrooms are neat and clean. In one word, the space is just beautiful. The menu has different types of delicious food items. They provide their best services to make you feel wow by yammi food with music. They always offer some of the best dishes from its affordable and budget-friendly menu. Best value proposition according to the price of Food. Some time they throw offers for discount over dishes. If you are lucky enough, you can avail those. Staffs are very much friendly and well mannered. Besides, the owner is also very polite, cordial and helpful minded. As there plays a lot of live music so it helps to create a groove atmosphere. They have the best studio and audio system for live music. Nice collection of Music can make anyone fan of this restaurant. Overall this is an awesome place amongst youngsters and people who want to experience the nightlife with live music and special menu. All this benefits has made this restaurant extraordinary and worthwhile visit for everyone.
